loans.name: Rosa Abigail

texts.es: Rosa de 50 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Rosa es una mujer que cuenta con el atributo de ser muy responsable y alegre a quien le gusta dedicarse de lleno a lo que hace. Ella posee una venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad, ya cuenta con varios años de trabajar de esta manera lo que le ha permitido ir obteniendo clientes fijos a lo largo del tiempo. El mayor deseo de Rosa es el de aumentar sus ventas y poder vivir de una mejor manera junto a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar variedad de verduras, así mismo comprar frutas para comercializar y de esta forma crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Rosa, 50, lives with her two children, both students.  She is a responsible woman, friendly and fully committed to whatever she is doing.  She operates a produce sales business in the local market.  She has operated the business for many years and can rely on the loyal set of customers that she has gained in those years.  She says that her hopes for the future are to grow her business and provide a decent life for herself and her family.  She is applying for an INTEGRAL loan that she will use to buy fruits and vegetables that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her fruits and vegetables business.

loans.name: Anastasie Vihoutou

texts.fr: Anastasie est âgée de 48ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 28ans. Elle vend des divers et des légumes depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce crédit lui permettra d'achever la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
Anastasie is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are already financially independent.  Her oldest child is 32 years old and the youngest is 28.

She has been selling various goods and vegetables for a few years and she stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to increase her capital and to meet her customers' demand, she has requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev.  

The additional income that she will make thanks to this loan will allow her to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy one box of mayonnaise jars, one box of milk cartons, one basket of carrots and one basket of leafy greens.

loans.name: Kelly Gisella

texts.es:
KELLY GISELLA tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene una hija, vive con el conyugue y la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

KELLY GISELLA se dedica a la agricultura, además cría animales cómo pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas.

 El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Kelly Gisella, 28, is in a common-law marriage and has a daughter.  She lives with her partner and her daughter in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios province.

Kelly is a member of the "5 de Septiembre" communal bank, which is located in Recinto Los Platanos in Ventanas canton, a place devoted to agriculture and livestock production.

Kelly Gisella is a farmer who also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid brushkiller.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers she needs for her crops.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Kelly's dream is to buy land where she could build her own house.  In her free time, she enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid brushkiller

loans.name: Rosa Lucrecia

texts.es:
ROSA LUCRECIA tiene 77 años de edad de estdo civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los platanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventnas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Rosa Lucrecia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Las compras las realizará en Mocache. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es comprar héctareas de terreno para sembrar más maíz. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar 
quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lucrecia is 77 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has no children. She lives with her husband in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Rosa is a member of the September 5th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Los Platanos in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and raising livestock.

Rosa Lucrecia is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer. Her purchases are conducted in Mocache. With the help of this loan, she will buy what she needs to plant her crops. Her dream is to buy plots of land so that she can plant more corn. The challenges she faces include dealing with pests.

In her free time, Rosa Lucrecia enjoys taking care of the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Tania De Los Andes

texts.es: Tania, de cuarenta y un años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee un taller de carpintería elabora mesas, sillas, bancos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en su trabajo y le ha traído muy buenas ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda en una localidad muy transitada de personas, es muy conocida por su excelente labor y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesita a precios realmente accesibles,  además de la calidad y el buen servicio que brinda; Tania es una mujer ejemplar, decidida y dedicada a su labor, le gusta luchar por lo que desea y quiere un futuro mejor por eso se esfuerza al máximo para alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y no posee materia prima para fabricar sus muebles, necesita realizar una nueva inversión para no decepcionar a sus clientes por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera, pegamento, clavos, etc. Tania tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que cancelará en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Tania de los Andes is forty-one years old. She lives together with her life partner and her children in their own house. She has a carpentry workshop where she makes tables, chairs, and benches, among other items. She has operated the business for many years, and this has provided her with valuable experience in her work and has brought her very good earnings. The business is located in her home, in an area where a lot of people pass by. She is very well known because of her excellent work, and she has attracted meany steady customers who prefer to buy from her because she has what they need at truly affordable prices. In addition, she offers quality and good service. Tania is an exemplary woman, determined and dedicated to her work. She likes to work hard to reach her goals, and she wants a better future; for this reason she is putting forth maximum effort to achieve the success she deserves. In recent weeks, the demand has increased, but she does not have raw materials. She needs to make a new investment so that she won't disappoint her customers. For this reason she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy wood, glue, nails, etc. Tania de los Andes has good credit references and an impeccable character. She promises to pay back according to schedule, and she has the hope that she will bring economic security to her household.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue and nails.

loans.name: Maria Filomena

texts.es: Maria Filomena de 44 años de edad, es una persona humilde y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y una hija que trabaja como niñera para poder pagar parte de sus estudios. María trabaja comercializando semillas de marañón y posee un puesto en el mercado central de su lugar de residencia en donde cuenta con clientes fijos quienes le compran por mayor sus productos. Para comprar la semilla que posteriormente vende, debe ir a un pueblo fuera del departamento en que reside, lo que hace más difícil la tarea de obtenerla, ella realiza esta actividad dos veces a la semana. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más semilla de marañón en las oportunidades que viaja y así volver mas rentable esos viajes pretendiendo reducir el viaje a sólo una vez por semana, con lo que puede ahorrarse bastante dinero, siendo ello de mucho beneficio para su negocio y hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Filomena, 44, is a humble, hardworking person living with her husband and daughter who works as a babysitter to be able to partially pay for her studies.  María works selling cashews; she has a stand in the central market in the place where she lives and she has regular customers who buy from her at wholesale.  

In order to buy the nuts she then resells, she has to travel to a town outside the department she lives in which makes getting them difficult; she does this task twice a week.  María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to have money needed to buy more cashews and be able to travel to the place where she buys them so she can save quite a bit of money this way which is of great benefit for her home.

loans.use: to buy cashews to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca de 41 años de edad, trabaja comercializando gallinas indias listas para cocinar, las vende en el mercado del lugar que reside, La carne de ésta gallina suele ser muy suave y preferida por la clientela de Blanca. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos quienes también colaboran con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más gallina ya que en muchas ocasiones se queda sin el capital para comprar las gallina por lo que no puede ir al mercado a venderlas, ocasionando grandes pérdidas para ella, por lo que espera mejorar en gran manera su negocio invirtiendo en el. Blanca es muy trabajadora y siempre está en busca de mejorar en la vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 41, works selling chickens that are ready to cook.  She sells them in her local market.  The meat from the chickens is very tender and popular with her clientele.  Blanca lives with her husband and two children who also help with household expenses.  She’s asking for the loan in order to have money needed to buy more chickens since she often runs out of capital to buy chickens which makes her unable to go to the market to sell them and this means large losses for her which is why she hopes to improve quite a bit by investing in it.  Blanca is very hardworking and is always seeking ways to improve in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, habitante de Managua, es comerciante, tiene 3 hijos de 28, 26 y 22 años de edad.
Se dedica a vender comida, pinolillo que es una bebida típica hecha a base de maíz, canela y cacao muy tradicional al mismo tiempo tiene una pulpería. Empezó desde muy joven el mundo del comercio  sus primeros productos fue la venta de cajetas, arroz con leche, buñuelos y vigoron todos postres y platos típicos desde entonces surgió la idea de poner su venta de comida. Gracias a esta actividad preparo a sus hijos, logro tener independencia económica y solventar los gastos de su hogar, aunque la competencia es a diario eso la hace esforzarse más por tener un negocio más diferente ofreciendo calidad de atención en sus comidas y en su pulpería.  Sus hijos la ayudaron siempre pues se dividían para ayudarle a vender y al mismo tiempo les enseño como ganarse la vida de manera honrada y ser responsables. 
Está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, verduras. Su demanda de clientes en su comideria y la pequeña pulpería ha ido aumentando y necesita ofrecer más productos. Su meta es ampliar el lugar para tener más capacidad para atender a sus clientes en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Flor, a resident of Managua, is a merchant.  She has three children, ages 28, 26, and 22.  She makes a living selling food, "pinolillo," a traditional drink made from corn, cinnamon, and cacao.  She also has a local store.

She started in the business world when she was very young.  The first products she sold were dulce de leche, rice pudding, doughnuts, and "vigorón" [yucca, pork rind, and cabbage], all desserts and traditional dishes.  Then she got the idea of selling food.  Thanks to this job she raised her children and managed to be financially independent and pay her household expenses.

Although there is daily competition, it makes her try harder to have a different business, offering quality service in foods and her store.  Her children always split up to help her, at the same time she taught them how to earn a living honorably and to be responsible.

She needs the loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, and vegetables.  Customer demand in her restaurant and the small store has increased and she needs to offer more products.  Her goal is to expand her place to have greater capacity to serve her customers in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, and vegetables

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, es soltero y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar, vive en una habitación alquilada, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz.
René estudió técnica electrónica y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como chofer (es dueño de un taxi) por más de ocho horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alquiler, alimentación y educación de su hija.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de su vehículo ya que desea comprar llantas y batería para mantener y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de René es aumentar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticretico para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
René is single and has a school-aged child.  He lives in a rented home, located in the Villa Copacabana neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

René studied electronics, and now earns an income working as a driver (he owns a taxi) for more than 8 hours a day.  He even works up to the late hours of the night, because he has to cover the expenses for rent, food and education for his daughter.  

He needs a loan to do general maintenance work on his vehicle; he wants to buy tires and a battery to maintain the vehicle and increase his income.

René's dream is to increase his income and acquire a house through an "anticretico" (lease arrangement) to improve his quality of life. 

This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO, and also the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to do general maintenance work on his taxi (buy tires and a battery)

loans.name: Adoubossou Group

texts.fr: ADOUBOSSOU est un groupement de vingt six personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Dannoumè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom Lambert. Dannoumè est mère de cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Dannoumè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a vingt ans environs que Dannoumè mène comme activité la vente de maïs, de l’huile de palme et de vin de palme à son domicile. Dannoumè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dannoumè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Dannoumè sollicite un cinquième crédit avec les autres membres du groupement ADOUBOSSOU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Adoubossou is a group of 26 people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same tontine [savings/investment group]. The group's representative, Dannoumè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 49 years old and is married to a farmer by the name of Lambert.

Dannoumè is the mother of five children, of whom several are in school and one remains in her care. Dannoumè did not attend school. It has been some 20 years that Dannoumè has been in the business of selling corn, palm oil and palm wine from her home. Dannoumè undertakes her business with passion, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.

Dannoumè gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Dannoumè is seeking a fifth loan with the other members of the Adoubossou Group. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to turn more of a profit. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase corn, palm oil and palm wine.

loans.name: Aurlie Kpodozounhoue

texts.fr: Agée de 37ans, Aurlie est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 12ans et 2ans. Elle distribue des divers depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur afin de les revendre en détail. Soucieuse d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en:
37 years old, Aurlie is married and the mother of two children, one of whom attends school. The elder and the younger are 12 years old and two years old, respectively.

Aurlie has been distributing various goods for several years and gets her supplies from wholesalers in one of the outdoor markets in order to resell them at retail. Eager to increase her supply capacity and to respond favorably to customer demand, she has sought and obtained a loan from Finadev with the goal of maximizing her profits and contributing to her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase five dozen disposable cups, two boxes of mayonnaise, one box of finger foods and one box of sweet corn.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian is a 44-year-old hard-working man with three children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Nine years ago he decided to begin trading in bananas and coffee, due to their lucrative nature. Most of his customers are traders from the city to export products to other countries, so he is able to get a reasonable price.  With the income he earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and build a house for residence.

Sebastian is requesting the loan to pay school fees for his children.  His dreams are to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and to have a sustainable food store that can supply the vast market.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Chandy's Group

texts.en:
Chandy is a 32-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. Besides rice farming, she also plants mango trees on a 1-hectare area of farmland. Engaging in this occupation for 12 years, she can earn approximately 44,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. A lack of working capital is the main challenge for her business. 

Chandy has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while the other group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her constantly support her family with enough food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Chandy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will use a portion of it to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to increase the income from the current business so as to fulfill her dream to buy plots of farmland for planting rubber trees in order to earn additional income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, who is 56 years old, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her; they are still too young for school. 

To feed the family, she has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about KHR 26,000 per day, and she manages to save around KHR 10,000 each day, after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield becaause of destruction by insects is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

She is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to buy a buffalo to help her in her farming business. This is the first microloan for Ry with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully, so as to make a better living and also to fulfill her dream of building a proper house for living in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a buffalo for her farm.

loans.name: Khvy

texts.en:
Khvy is 27 years old and married. She has two children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Me Mot district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice on a 1.5 hectare area of farmland and also supplementing the income by growing cassava on three hectare of farmland. Having been in business for six years, they are able to earn about US$10 per day and manage to save about US$3 each day after daily expenses. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for her farming business.

Khvy has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has fully paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her current business. Now she is requesting a loan of US$1,250 from VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation business. Through this loan, she hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to sell it for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Saphan's Group

texts.en:
Saphan is 57 years old, married and blessed with seven children. She resides in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has been farming rice on a 2-hectare area of farmland for 37 years and supplements the income by raising pigs. The current occupation earns her family about 20,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and allows them to save about 7,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Saphan has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her family's living conditions. She is now applying for a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Edwin Jhoany

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven muy trabajador que desde hace 6 años montó su negocio de venta de accesorios para teléfonos con el cual ha podido generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir económicamente a sus padres. Desde que montó el negocio ha venido creciendo mucho, y superando las dificultades de capital que se le presentan constantemente; para esto han sido fundamentales sus ganas de salir adelante y su fortaleza que siempre lo ha caracterizado. Buscando mejorar las ventas de su negocio y responder a la demanda de los clientes, Edwin busca un préstamo que le permita comprar surtido de accesorios para celulares.

Su sueño es poder tener unas ventas más grandes y así mejorar los ingresos para ofrecerles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar y mejores oportunidades económicas. Además, aspira a conseguir su propio local para montar el negocio.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young entrepreneur who established six months ago his business of selling phone accessories. This enables him to generate his own income so that he can assist his parents financially. Since starting his business, his venture has grown tremendously. Edwin is able to overcome constant difficulties with obtaining capital. The results he has achieved have been attributed to his drive to succeed and the strength for which he has always been known. He is seeking to improve his business sales and respond to the demand from his customers, so Edwin is requesting a loan so that he can purchase more mobile phone accessories.

His dream is to have increased sales and improve his earnings so that he can provide his parents a better quality of life at home and better financial opportunities. In addition, he aspires to acquire his own storefront where he can relocate his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Annaleah

texts.en:
Annaleah is a farmer’s wife who is engaged in selling slippers in their community. Because it's a poor living, she needs to work hard. She doesn’t want to depend on her husband. To further improve their living conditions, she also helps in uplifting their lifestyle.

She is 37 years old and has one child. She wishes for a good life and a bright future for her child. Consequently, she is asking a loan amount PHP 15000 to buy shoes and slippers as additional goods to sell. She hopes this will lead to a boom her income in order to make her business prosper.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: St Theresa Women Group

texts.en:
Alex is a 31-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been dealing in electronics for two years. After realising that farming was seasonal and could not enable him to meet daily expenses, he decided to start his current business to supplement his agricultural activities.  Like most traders, he is challenged by price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the high demand.

Alex intends to use the loan facility to buy electronics, such as cables and bulbs, to sell.  He is a member of the above group, where each member guarantees the other in obtaining credit facilities.  He has dreams of educating his children and having a big shop in town.

loans.use: to buy electronics such as cables and bulbs to sell.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a conservative woman; she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Maha and her husband were able to buy a small van to use in distributing the cleaning products they refill and sell. Later on, they started selling various products other than detergents using the van. 

Finding that they are having more success in selling ordinary products as shown in the photo than how they did with the cleaning products, Maha has decided to minimize the quantity of cleaning products and focus more on other goods. For that purpose, she has applied for this loan to bring in more goods and products that they can sell around the neighborhood and distribute for the market.

loans.use: to bring more goods and products

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married with eight children, living in Hioma, Uganda. 

He is a produce dealer and has been in this business for over eight years. He is faced with challenges of seasonal weather variations, which makes the prices of produce fluctuate, and inadequate capital to exploit the ready market. 

John intends to use the loan to buy produce, such as beans and maize, to sell. In the future he hopes to move his business to a more permanent location, instead of moving from one market to the other.

His family goal is to work hard and ensure that all his children get educated.

loans.use: to buy more produce, such as beans and maize, to sell.

loans.name: Siriphas

texts.en:
Siriphas is a 35-year-old married man with two children, living in Kasese,Uganda. 

He is a nursing officer and works in two  hospitals within the same town. He has a number of dreams, which include educating his children, upgrading in his studies, and buying land to grow crops.  Like most government workers, he has the challenge of low salary pay, working overtime, and a high cost of living.  

Siriphas needs the loan facility to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is a 27-year-old rice farmer who lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has one daughter who is still under school age. Besides growing rice on a two-hectare area of farmland, she also supplements her income by working as a paid worker in the local area. Having engaged in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

Mom is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. She is going to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy two buffaloes for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and two buffaloes for raising

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom, a 28-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two children to take care of and they are too young for school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for 10 years. The current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day and she can save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Insects are the main challenge for her rice paddy business.

This is the first microloan for Sarom’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sarom will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her farming business so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Fasaiel

texts.en: Fasaiel is a 38-year-old woman who lives and supports herself now that her parents have passed away. She is a farmer by day, and she sells home products in the evenings so she can make enough money to support herself. She hopes to get the loan so she can expand her business into selling clothes in addition to home products and increase her sales.

loans.use: to add clothes to her home products sales business

loans.name: Mireya Yancarla

texts.es: La Sra.  Mireya tiene 37 tiene 4 hijos, que se encuentran estudiando,  ella necesita el dinero en esta ocasión para la compra de mesas y sillas ya que esta incursionando en otra actividad que es la venta de comida ya que alquilo un local como restaurante que tiene que equipar por este motivo solicito el crédito, su deseo para su negocio es tener una cadena de restaurantes y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Mireya es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sra. Mireya is 37 years old and has four children who are in school. She needs a loan on this occasion so that she can buy tables and chairs. Mireya is starting another business by selling food from a rented location. The reason why she is requesting this loan is because she needs to furnish her restaurant in order to provide good service to her customers.

Sra. Mireya is a hardworking person who is pleased with the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is an ambitious woman living in Marka with her husband and four sons. She started her own mini market at her home to help her husband, who works as a taxi driver to support the family. She would like to buy new products so she can expand her market, send to more people, and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy new food products

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es: José tiene25 años de edad estado civil casado , tiene 2 hijos .El comenzó en la venta de comida trabajando en un restaurante de un amigo, actualmente ella se independizo y trabaja solo. El  trabaja desde la 6.am hasta 15:00pm. El vende arroz con menestra y pollo. Su meta es tener un gran restaurante propio de comidas típicas ecuatorianas .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina una y ollas y platos,mesas ,sillas
texts.en: José is 25 years old, is married and has two children. She began selling food while working in a restaurant of a friend. Now, he became independent and works alone. He works from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm. He sells rice with vegetable stew and chicken. His goal is to own a big restaurant for Ecuadorian typical food. With the loan he will buy a kitchen, pots, and plates, tables, and chairs.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen, pots and plates, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Luis Oscar

texts.es:
Luis trabaja en la actividad de la carpintería desde hace 15 años, y con esta ha venido generando los ingresos que necesita en su hogar para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Gracias a toda la experiencia que ha adquirido ahora puede tener buenas ventas, y esto facilita a veces la superación de las grandes dificultades económicas que tiene en su hogar. Debido a que ahora tiene un muy buen pedido por parte de un cliente, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder responder por este, Luis busca un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos y materias primas que necesita para la fabricación de un gran pedido que tiene por parte de un cliente.

Su sueño es ampliar este negocio mejorando sus ventas y así sus ingresos para el hogar, de modo que pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y las condiciones económicas no se vuelvan a deteriorar.
texts.en:
Luis has worked in carpentry for 15 years. This has enabled him to generate the income he needs to maintain his home for the benefit of his wife and their two children. Thanks to all of the experience he has acquired, Luis has been able to generate good sales and overcome great difficulties he occasionally faces at home.

Now he has a large order from one of his clients, but he does not have enough capital to complete this order. Luis is seeking a loan so that he can buy supplies and raw materials that he needs to complete this large order on behalf of his client.

His dream is to expand his business so that he can improve his sales and household income. This will enable him to improve his family’s quality of life and prevent his financial condition from deteriorating again.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, Mao is a 35-year-old married woman who has been selling grocery items as the main source of her family’s income for nine years. To add up more income, she also plants rubber trees in her local area. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her daily income is approximately 15,000 riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The main challenge for her business is lacking of working capital.
 
Mao’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and completely repaid the past loans. She has wisely used the previous loans to constantly support her family's livelihood. Now she and one group member are requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each; while the remaining member is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 KHR. As the leader, Mao will use her portion to buy more grocery items to sell and will use a portion of it to purchase plastic mulch for her rubber plantation business. With this loan, she hopes to get a high yield so as to better her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for selling

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Efdison Vicente

texts.es:
EFDISON VICENTE tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

EFDISON VICENTE se dedica a la siembra, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas,  urea, líquido para la maleza. Las compras lo hace en Quinsaloma.

El sueño es comprar un terreno, Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades que caen en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en los campos.
texts.en:
Efdison Vicente is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He lives with his family in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Efdison is a member of the September 5th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Los Platanos in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and raising livestock.

Efdison Vicente plants crops and also raises animals. He is requesting a loan to buy insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer. His purchases are conducted in Quinsaloma. Efdison’s dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges he faces include diseases that cause his crops to decline.

In his free time, Efdison Vicente enjoys working in the fields.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Kak's Group

texts.en:
Kak is 52 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district. She has six children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Rice growing is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living, and she has been in this business for 32 years. Her daily income is approximately 16,000 KHR. She manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The scarcity of water supply is the main challenge for her farming business. 

This is Kak’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group is composed of two members who live in the same village. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and have a large increase in income to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
Maria aprendió el negocio trabajando al lado de su madre y desde muy joven tiene la experiencia en esta actividad. Durante muchos trabajó en el puesto de venta de comidas que tenía su madre y ya cuando ella no pudo trabajar más se hizo cargo del negocio. Hace unos años sus hijos no quisieron que Maria siguiera trabajando por dificultades de salud, pero desde hace 10 meses ha retomado el negocio y ha vuelto a sacar su puesto de venta de comidas. Como no cuenta con mucho capital ha tenido grandes dificultades, pero para esto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar utensilios de trabajo, insumos para la preparación de las comidas, realizar adecuaciones locativas al puesto, y poder mejorar el negocio.

De esta manera podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos, además de ofrecer mayor calidad en la atención a sus clientes. Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante ofreciéndole a sus clientes mejores atenciones para que así mejoren sus ventas.
texts.en:
María learned how to manage a business by working alongside her mother from a very young age. After gaining a great deal of experience working at her mother’s food stand, María took over the business when her mother was no longer able to work. A few years ago, María’s children did not want her to continue working because of health problems. Ten months ago, María returned to her business and reopened the food stand. She is experiencing great difficulties since she does not have much capital, so María is seeking a loan so that she can buy utensils and supplies for preparing food. She will also make renovations to the food stand so that she can improve her business.

The loan will enable her to offer a wider variety of products and provide high-quality service to her customers. Her dream is to move her business forward by providing the best service so that she can improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies for preparing food and to pay for renovations to her food stand.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, es casado y tiene una hija pequeña, vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer propietario de un taxi de servicio de pasajeros por más de doce horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de su vehículo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Marcos, es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcos is married and has a young daughter. He lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Marcos studied through high school and currently works as a taxi driver. He offers his services for more than 12 hours a day and this is the only way for him to pay the cost of food and basic services for his family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for general maintenance of his vehicle. This is the only source of income by which he is able to support his family. Marcos’ dream is improve his income and his quality of life.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for general vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Leyhong's Group

texts.en:
Leyhong, age 33, is a married mother of two dependent children who has been engaged in rice growing in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. All of her children are too young for school. Besides farming, she also raises pigs while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income for the family. They have been in this business for five years. The current occupation earns them approximately 14,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low yield because of drought is the main challenge for her farming business. 

Leyhong received her first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, two cycles ago while the other member is new with VisionFund this cycle. Leyhong fully paid back the loans, which have helped better support her current business. Now she and her group member are applying for another loan of 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig feed for her pig raising. Through this loan, Leyhong hopes to grow her current business to earn a larger income so as to make convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Samart is 42 years old and a rice farmer in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom are dependent on her; some are still in school in local area and some help the family’s business. 

She has been growing rice on two hectares of farmland for 25 years, while her husband supplements their income by making palm juice. They are able to earn about KHR 20,000K per day and manage to save about KHR 15,000 each day, after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge to her business.    

Samart has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles, while the other member ofher group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Samart has completely repaid her loans, which have helped her to support her paddy field.

Now she and her group member would like to request another loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. 

Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her farming business, so as to keep up a good progress of her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run is a 53-year-old widowed mother who lives with six children in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. Out of her six children, she still has three children to take care of. They are employed at a garment factory in the area helping the family to earn extra income. To support her family, she has struggled to grow rice on two hectares of farmland. Her daily income is approximately 20,000 riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.  

Run has been with VisionFund for three cycles; while the other member is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She has fully repaid her loans. Run has smartly and successfully utilized the previous loans to support her current business. Now she is leading her group in this request for a new loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to improve her standard of living as well as to increase her income from the current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON est un groupement de vingt personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Micheline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Alexandre. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Micheline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Micheline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Micheline mène comme activité la vente des friperies dans une région du Bénin. Micheline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Micheline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Micheline sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement NONVIGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Nonvignon is a group of 20 individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Micheline (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 40 years old and married. Her husband’s name is Alexandre. They have three dependent children, all in school. Micheline lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for their children. Micheline did not attend school. For almost seven years, Micheline has been selling second-hand clothing in a region of Benin. Micheline is dedicated to her work which allows her to support herself and her children. Micheline stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Micheline, together with the other members of the Nonvignon group, is seeking her first loan. This loan will allow group members to better respond to customer demand and increase their revenues.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a widow living with her daughter. Choosing not to surrender to her circumstances and ask for help from her family, she works from her home making clothes out of wool. She hopes to get this loan so she can buy more raw materials, make more products to sell and increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials

loans.name: Chanrun

texts.en:
Chanrun is a 21-year-old farmer who lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is married with one dependent daughter who is still under school age. She has been farming rice on a 2-hectare area of farmland for four years while her husband has been working as a teacher in the local area to earn additional income. The current business earns her family approximately 18,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and allows them to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

This is the first microloan for Chanrun with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is asking for a loan of US $500 from VisionFund. Chanrun is going to use her loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a proper house for living in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jessica Belén

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 19 años, es una chica muy responsable en todas sus actividades, le gusta superarse cada día y lo más importante es que es muy humilde. Jessica vive con sus padres en Salcedo.

Jessica es estudiante universitaria, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos, vacas entre otros; este negocio le ayuda a sustentar sus estudios y puede ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, Jessica sueña en incrementar su negocio constantemente es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi con el objetivo de comprar de 5 crías de cerdos rosados, para la compra de balanceado y para la adecuación de los corrales, inversión que incrementará su negocio y aumentarán sus ventas.

Jessica sueña en tener una casa propia, formar una familia y ser profesional para administrar de una mejor manera su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica is 19 years old and is a very responsible girl in all her activities. She likes to improve herself everyday and most importantly she is very humble. Jessica lives with her parents in Salcedo. Jessica is a university student and also raises animals such as pigs, cows among others; this business helps her support her studies and helps her parents with their household expenses. 

Jessica dreams of constantly increasing her business and that is why she is requesting a loan from Fodemi with the objective of buying 5 pink piglets, to purchase animal feed and for the adequacy of the pens; investment that will increase her business and increase her sales. 

Jessica dreams of having her own house, raising a family and to be a professional to manage her business better.

loans.use: to buy 5 pink piglets, to purchase animal feed and for the adequacy of the pens.

loans.name: Saint Dominique Group

texts.fr:
Mr WENDINMANEGDE(Moustapha) représente le groupe saint Dominique. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Il se porte bien. Le plus âgé a 4 ans et le moins âgé à 12 mois. Personne ne va  à l’école et il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr  vend de sacs à main et des chaussures  depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne au yaar  du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  15 sacs à main et 20 chaussures.
Mr  réinvesti ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne  agrandir sa boutique, et scolarisé ses enfants quand ils auront l’âge d’aller à l’école.
texts.en:
Wendinmanegde (a.k.a. Moustapha) is the representative of the Saint Dominique group.  He is doing well.  He is married and the father of two children.  His oldest child is 4 years old, the youngest is 12 months old.  Neither of his children goes to school.  He has two people in his care.

He has been selling handbags and shoes for 10 years.  He stocks up at the market of district 10 and sells to both men and women.  

Wendinmanegde wants to buy 15 handbags and 20 pairs of shoes.

He reinvests his profits in his activity.  His dream is to expand his business and to send his children to school when they are old enough to go.

loans.use: to buy 15 handbags and 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica a la venta de masas, específicamente en sopaipillas y empanadas, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa y algunas veces sale a vender sus productos a el centro de la ciudad en su carrito, la acompaña uno de sus hijos, su horario es de lunes a sábado de 16ºº a 21ºº horas.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados donde encuentra sus productos para la elaboración de sus masas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará harina, zapallo, huevos, aceites para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Margarita es seguir con su rubro para poder arreglar su casa y tener  una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus hijos.
Margarita vive junto a sus 3 hijos, unos gemelos de 14 años de edad y uno de 16 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es poder comprar una sobador (es una máquina utilizada para el estirado de la masa) y revolvedora (revolvedora de masas) y a nivel personal son brindarles a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Margarita is part of the communal bank "Forjadoras de sueños", belonging to the city of Rancagua. She sells pastries, specifically sopaipillas [fried pastries] and pies, for six years. She says she works from home and sometimes goes out to sell her products to the city center with her cart. One of her children accompanies her. Her schedule is Monday to Saturday from 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm. She buys merchandise in supermarkets where she finds products to elaborate her pastries at low cost, therefore economically convenient.

With the loan she will buy flour, pumpkin, eggs, and oil to stock her business. One of Margarita's goals is to continue with her work so she can repair her home and have a better quality of life with her children. Margarita lives with her three children, two twins who are 14 years old and one who is 16 years old, all of them are studying. Her dreams in a work level are to buy a "sobador" [a machine used to stretch the dough] and a stirring machine [to stir the dough]. In a personal level, she wants to provide a better quality of life to her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it allowed her to invest in her business. Also, she feels comfortable with the company of other entrepreneurs in the communal bank's group, because they share different activities and interests, which she also uses as a moment of entertainment. Regarding the training given in the meetings, she learned to manage better her business.

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins area. It is a modern city that regulates the main process of production and exportation of fruits, vegetables and wine in Chile. It's also a mining city, because in its mountain range there is the largest underground mine in the world called "El Teniente", with 4,500 km of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy flour, pumpkin, eggs, and oil to stock her business.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 43, is married with four children. Her family lives in a rural area in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has one child to take care of who is still in school. To make a living, Chan has been engaging in farming rice on 5 hectares of farmland for twenty years, while her husband sells firewood in the local area. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 
 
Chan’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has fully paid back the previous loans which have helped her constantly support her family with enough food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Chan will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to better her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a 57-year-old woman living in Marka.  She works from her home knitting and making clothes and selling to her friends and neighbors. She would like to get a loan so she can expand her work and buy more wool to start selling to the local market and not just to her friends.

loans.use: buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 43-year-old woman living in Salt with her 4 children. Her oldest daughter is a university student and in her last year majoring in English language. Hanan supports her family in paying the rent and expenses and she would like to take out this loan so she can pay for her daughter’s university fees, as she would love to see her daughter get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: pay for her daughter’s university fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 31-year-old single man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to pay for items for his marriage.  He would like to buy furniture and other household items so that he can arrange his house for his future wife before their marriage. He hopes to create a comfortable space for his family.

loans.use: buy furniture and household items

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 27-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in a rural area in the Kror kor district of Battambang province. All of her children are dependent on her and still too young for school. To make a living, Mom has been involving in selling grocery items. Having been in this occupation for several years, she is able to earn about 12,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Mom’s group consists of two members who are new with VisionFund this cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund for  1,000,000 KHR each. She is going to utilize her portion to buy grocery items for selling such as salt, sugar and eggs, etc. With this loan, she hopes increase more income from her current business so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy, 20, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and has one son who is too young for school. Rice farming on one hectare of farmland is the main source of the family’s income, which Channy has been in for one year. To add more income for the family, her husband also works for others for a fee in the local area. The current business earns them approximately KHR 22,000 per day and they manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Channy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Channy hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice fruitfully and timely so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anood

texts.en: Anood is a young girl who is a university student living in Mafraq. Her major is animal production. Being a responsible girl trying to help her parents pay for her expenses, she hopes to get the loan so she can pay for her university semester.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of university.

loans.name: Hibah

texts.en: Hibah is a 36-year-old divorced woman from Nao'or in Jordan. She has a child and has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a mother of four children living in Wehdat, which is in east Amman. She has her own business that she runs from her home selling various products such as blankets and clothes to cover her expenses, as well as her children’s expenses. She would like to get a loan so she can increase the quantity she has and add selling clothes to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to add clothes to her business

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Najah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Najah is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future Najah wants to renew the furniture, curtains and kitchen.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Haleemah

texts.en: Haleemah is a 47-year-old single woman living at her sister’s place. She has her own women’s beauty salon for over 16 years now. She hopes to get this loan so she can expand her salon and buy new tools to increase her profit.

loans.use: buy hair salon tools

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, aged 56, resides in a rural area in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia.  She has five children. To make a living, she has been engaged in cassava planting and selling grocery items in the local area. Her husband supplements their income by working as a motorbike repairer in the local area and sometimes he also works a motor-taxi driver. The current businesses earns them approximately 30,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low yield is still their main challenge.

Pheap’s group consists of four members who have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles.  Pheap had completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her current business. She is now leading her group to apply for a new loan. She is going to utilize this loan to buy more grocery items for selling and use a portion of it to buy materials for her husband’s business.  She hopes this loans will enable her family to increase to a large income so as to make their living better.

loans.use: buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 44-year-old married female from Al Nasser in Jordan. She has six children and requested a 400 Jordan dinar (JOD) loan to pay for her home improvements and painting expenses. In the future, Ibtisam would like to build her own home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pucho Luis tiene 50 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Pucho Luis se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace.
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno y una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades por el mal clima.

En el tiempo libre le gusta conversar con los amigos y con el padre.
texts.en:
Pucho Luis is 50 years old, married, and has no children. He lives with his wife in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. He is a member of “Ventanilla 5 de septiembre” [Window to September 5th] which is located in the banana precinct in the Ventanas canton. This region’s main economic activities are agriculture and livestock.

Pucho Luis makes a living in agriculture and breeding animals. He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid herbicide. With the help of this loan, he will buy a lot of things that he is lacking; he will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

His dream is to buy land and a house. The biggest challenges he faces are conditions due to bad weather. 

In his free time, Pucho Luis likes to talk with his friends and his father.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, and liquid herbicide

loans.name: Winter David

texts.es:
WINTER DAVID tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, vive con el hijo y la conyugue en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

WINTER DAVID se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas y Quinsaloma. El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y boli.
texts.en:
Winter David is 25 years old. He is in a common-law marriage in which he has a three year old son. He lives with his son and partner in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province, Ecuador. He is a member of “Ventanilla 5 de septiembre” [Window to September 5th] which is located in the banana precinct in the Ventanas canton. This region’s main economic activities are agriculture and livestock.

Winter David makes a living in agriculture and breeding animals. He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid herbicide. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for agriculture. He will make his purchases in Ventanas and Quinsaloma. 

His dream is to buy land. The biggest challenges he faces are illnesses. In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, urea, and liquid herbicide

loans.name: Maison

texts.en: Maison is a 36-year-old married woman with two family members and is from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture for the living room and some households items for the kitchen. She hopes to create a comfortable space for her family and to buy a home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en: Ayed is a 49-year-old father of three and runs his own retail business in Marka. He owns a small shop for children’s clothes. He has been in the business for almost three years now. He would like to get a loan so he can get a new autumn and winter clothing collection to cover all tastes and offer a variety of  fashions so he can increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to but a new autumn and winter collection for his children's clothing store.

loans.name: Yosra

texts.en: Yosra is a 49-year-old mother of five. She lives with her family in Zarqa. Yosra runs a mini market in the same area where she lives and she would like to get a loan so she can enhance her business with new products and also to change some of the decor in hopes of raising her sales to help support her family.

loans.use: to add new products and change some of the decor.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha lives with her husband in Karak, and they support seven members of their family as well. Her husband is a government chauffeur by day and a private chauffeur in the evening. She helps with the expenses through working in tailoring and embroidery from home. She wishes to get the loan to buy more material so she can increase her productivity and hopefully have her own little workshop.

loans.use: to buy more material.

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en: Anaam and her husband opened a small sweets shop. She helps him by making various kinds of sweets at home to sell. She would like to get the loan so she can buy raw materials and more ingredients and offer new varieties of sweets at the shop to expand her customers and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients needed to make sweets and pastries.

loans.name: Nayadeth

texts.es:
Nayadeth forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de Sueños” perteneciente  a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de agro-veterinaria (venta de productos agrícolas y productos veterinarios), desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado, y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Además realiza otras labores como vivero de plantas medicinales, venta de joyas de plata, producción de alfajores, pero su fuerte y que le ha dado mayores recursos es agro-veterinario. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de San Fernando, ya que encuentra los productos necesarios para su negocio ya sea en agrícola y productos veterinarios, a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará joyas específicamente aros, anillos y cadenas.
Una de las metas de Nayadeth es crecer cada dia con su negocio, y ver la posibilidad de tener otro rubro para generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Nayadeth vive junto a su madre, quienes se cuidan mutuamente. Sus sueños a nivel personal es viajar para darse  un descanso, y a nivel laboral continuar con el rubro y abastecerlo para su clientela, y dejarla satisfecha al momento de la venta.
Ella se encuentra contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos, Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte s e siente cómoda ya que son responsables.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Nayadeth is part of the communal bank "Forjadoras de Sueños", belonging to the city of Rancagua. She is engaged in the business of agro-veterinary [ sale of agricultural products and veterinary products], since one year. She says she works from Monday to Saturday, and she distributes the schedule according to her availability. Also, she performs other jobs like nursery of medicinal plants, sale of silver jewelry, and production of alfajores, but what has given her more resources is her agro-veterinary business.

She buys her merchandise in the city of San Fernando, where she finds the necessary products for her business, whether it's agricultural or veterinary products, at low cost and therefore economically convenient.

With the loan she will buy jewelry, specifically earrings, rings and chains. One of Nayadeth goals is to grow every day with her business, and to see the possibility to have another business to generate more income and to have a better quality of life. Nayadeth lives with her mother, and they take care of each other. Her dreams in a personal level is to travel to take a break, and in a work level is to continue with her business and stock it for her customers, to satisfy them with the sale.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it allowed her to invest in her business. She says the trainings have been critical for her business and also for her personal development, because she has learned to organize and distribute better her income. Regarding to the communal bank to which she belongs, she feels comfortable because they are very responsible.  

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins area. It is a modern city that regulates the main process of production and exportation of fruits, vegetables and wine in Chile. It's also a mining city, because in its mountain range there is the largest underground mine in the world called "El Teniente", with 4,500 km of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, specifically earrings, rings, and chains.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
María se considera ser una persona alegre, de buen caracter, amigable y sobre todo muy responsable en su trabajo. María vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos muy cerca de Latacunga.

María se dedica a la venta de carnes asadas en un coche ambulante, le va muy bien tiene buena aceptación de sus clientes, para mejorar su servicio a los clientes María necesita invertir en la compra de una nueva parrilla para su coche ya que la actual está muy detereorada y para la compra de carnes y embutidos para seguir con su negocio, con esta inversión mejorará la atención al cliente y mejorara sus ventas e ingresos.

María sueña en comprar un local para atender mejor a sus clientes y seguir emprendiendo en su negocio para que sus hijos sigan y triunfen en la vida.
texts.en:
María considers herself to be a happy person of good character, friendly, and above all very responsible in her work.  María lives with her husband and their four children very near to Latacunga.

María works selling grilled meats in her vendor car. It’s going very well; she is very popular among her customers. In order to improve service to her customers, María needs to invest in the purchase of a new grill for her car - as her current one is very worn – and the purchase of meats and sausages to continue with her business. With this loan, she will improve attention to her customers and improve her sales and income. 

María dreams of purchasing a small store to better attend to her customers, and to continue engaging in her business so that her children keep going and are successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase a new grill for her vendor car and to buy meats and sausages to continue with her business.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Because Shireen is a conservative woman, she asked her brother to take her place in the photo.

Shireen is a 30-year-old woman who works in a salon and lives in Zarqa. She is married and lives with her husband. Being a responsible, loving sister, she wants to help her family in any way possible. Therefore, she wants to get this loan so she can help her younger brother pay for his university fees and start his second year to hopefully get a university degree in two more years.

loans.use: To pay for her brother's university fees

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is a young 28-year-old mother of three children. Phan provides for her family by growing pineapple and rice crops. 

Phan's main challenge is the lack of working capital to support her business. She has therefore formed a group with two others to seek a loan from Kiva's partner, VisionFund. All the members of the group are first time borrowers, and they are  each seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR). Phan is the group leader, and she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for both her cash crops. She hopes that she will receive a good yield, and make more income for her family's sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina de 58 años y su esposo Marino de 56 años tiene 3 hijos, que a pesar de ser mayores de edad siempre están al servicio y apoyo de sus padres. Juntos viven en una casa propia de material noble. Nos muestra con mucha alegría su logro de haber concretado hace 20 años su bodega, cuya acogida siempre fue aceptable por el publico, en un cómodo ambiente dentro de su casa. Le agrada que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan y sabe que es la única manera de mantener el liderazgo en su barrio y no disminuir sus ganancias, aunque como la demanda obliga que día a día salgan al mercado nuevos productos y su bodega no podía ser la excepción para comercializarlos. Por ello requiere de un dinero adicional para poder realizar la compra de los mismos y no perder clientela. Asimismo necesitará más espacio y nuevos andamios para poder tener su negocio siempre vistoso y surtido, sin descartar que a futuro esta planeando ampliar su bodega aún más. Son 8 crédityos que tiene con MFP, tiene el gusto de comentarnos que siempre fue puntual debido a que el dinero invertido fue buen administrado por ella y su esposo. Asimismo se caracteriza por ser una persona que le gusta el orden en su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 contratará al carpintero de su barrio para la construcción de un andamio y ya hizo el pedido a sus proveedor de mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is 58 years old; her husband Marino is 56 years old and they have 3 children, who, due to being older, are always at the service of and supporting their parents. They live together in their own house made of fine materials. They happily show us their success in having completed their store 20 years ago, which always favorably received the public in a comfortable environment inside their house. 

She is pleased that her customers find what they’re looking for, and she knows that this is the only way of maintaining leadership in her neighborhood and not reducing her income. However, demand requires that day after day, she take new products to the market and that her store is not the only place for selling them. For this, she needs additional money to carry out the purchase of the aforementioned items and not lose customers. Likewise, she will need more space and new shelving to be able to always keep her business attractive and well stocked, without dismissing that in the future, she is planning to expand her business more. 

She has 8 loans with MFP; she has the pleasure of commenting to us that she was always punctual, because the invested money was well managed by her and her husband. Likewise, she describes herself as being a person who likes the order of her communal bank.
