With the 2,000 PEN, she will hire a carpenter from her neighborhood for the construction of shelving, and she already made the request to her merchandise provider to stock up her business.

loans.use: To purchase shelving, basic needs items, and to hire a worker.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
DORA ELIZABETH tiene 46 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

DORA ELIZABETH se dedica a la agricultura y a la críanza de animales cómo pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, semillas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas o en Quinsaloma. El sueño es comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar labores de la casa y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Dora Elizabeth is 46 years old, in a civil union, and has two children. She lives with her partner and children in the city of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the 5th of September Communal Bank located in the Los Plátanos precinct of Ventanas canton, whose members work in agriculture and fishing.

Dora Elizabeth dedicates herself to farming and raising animals like chickens and pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer, and seeds.

With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy fertilizers for her planting. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas or in Quinsaloma. Dora Elizabeth's dream is to buy a plot of land. In her free time, she likes to do housework and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer, and seeds

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: NONVIGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent des activités génératrices de revenus dans une même zone. La représentante du groupe, Assiba Pascaline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Quirin. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Assiba Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges des enfants. Assiba Pascaline a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a cinq années que Assiba Pascaline mène comme activité la vente des appareils électroménagers à une place publique du Bénin afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage. Assiba Pascaline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Assiba Pascaline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Assiba Pascaline sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés
texts.en:
The Nonvigbe Group is a group of three people, the members of which conduct profit-making businesses in the same area. The group's representative, Assiba Pascaline (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 36 years old and is married to a man named Quirin. The couple has three children, certain of them in school and all of them under the couple's care. Assiba Pascaline lives together with her husband. The couple shares the various expenses of their children.

Assiba Pascaline did not receive much education. For five years now, she has been selling household appliances in a public square in Benin to contribute to the various household expenses. She undertakes her business with passion, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children. Assiba Pascaline gets her supplies in a town in Benin.

With the goal of customer satisfaction, Assiba Pascaline is seeking a third loan with the other members of the Nonvigbe Group. This loan will allow them to better meet customer demand and to turn a greater profit. The previous loans received have been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary, a mother of six children, is 42 years old and a rice farmer. For the 10 years that she has engaged in her rice farm, she has been able to earn about 21,000 KHR per day and her net saving, after deducting all expenses, is only 5,000 KHR per day. In order to improve the personal hygiene in her household, she formed a group of five members to request a loan for a latrine. As a group leader, her loan portion will be used to purchase the necessary materials for building a decent latrine for her family's use. She hopes that this latrine will help her to promote good health for her family.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Chamrath's Group

texts.en: Chamrath, 40, is a rice farmer originally from the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia.  In total, she has four children, but only two are schoolchildren. To sustain this family, she has been farming for 16 years. She also runs a small food stall for extra income. Chamrath has been with VisionFund for ages, (more than six cycles). The prior loans have helped her to overcome the financial difficulty of running both businesses and sustaining her household. To continue this good progress, she formed a group of two to seek a new loan. She is requesting 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is requesting  1,000,000 KHR. Chamrath, as a leader, is going to spend her portion to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes this purchase will minimize her low production caused by pests and increase its productivity so as she can double her income and keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Naimatou

texts.fr: Agée de 34ans, Naimatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école de la place. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 23ans et 12ans. Elle a une boutique sise au cœur de la ville où elle vend des articles de mercerie depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Naimatou is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are students at a local school. The eldest and the youngest are 23 and 12 years old, respectively.

Naimatou has a shop located in the town center, where she has been selling notions for several years. She gets her supplies in one of the markets in Benin and beyond. With the goal of strengthening her business and meeting the expectations of her customers, she has turned to Finadev's microfinance program in order to maximize her additional income and contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase three boxes of buttons, one box of spools of thread, two dozen fasteners and three bolts of poplin.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en: Sokchea is a 38-year-old mother of two schoolchildren and two paid workers. To tackle her family's hardships, she has been farming with her husband for 10 years. Besides assisting in the rice-field, her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income. Sokchea's group is composed of two female members, both sixth-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The prior loans, which she has totally paid back, have provided her with daily decent food and kept her children in school. As a result, she and her co-member are applying for 800,000 KHR and 600,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she is going to use her entire portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she will grow her rice timely so that she can maintain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de minimarket, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, adapto un lugar para poner su negocio, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 9ºº hasta las 01ºº de la mañana, algunas veces cierra más tarde ya que su clientela va tarde a jugar a las maquinas que tiene habilitadas en su negocio.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para abastecer su negocio, los compra en supermercados, vendedores de lácteos y cecinas de marca, distribuidoras de bebidas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería específicamente, bebidas, helados, azúcar. Te, fideos, cecinas y yogurt.
Una de las metas de Inés es salir adelante y seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que gracias a éste tiene las necesidades básicas de una familia y ha podido sacar a sus hijos adelante con los estudios. 
Ines vive junto a su marido, gemelos de 7 años de edad, una hija de 20 años de edad, du suegra y su madre. Sus sueños a nivel personal y familiar es salir de vacaciones con su marido e hijos, comenta que hace mas de 10 años que no sale a ninguna parte, y a nivel laboral crecer para generar mas ingresos y una estabilidad económica a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Inés is part of the "Forjadoras de Sueños" ("Dream Shapers") Communal Bank in the city of Rancagua.

She has run a mini-market for six years. She explains that she works in her house, where she adapted a space to set up her business. She works from Monday through Sunday from 9:00 to 1:00 in the morning. Sometimes she closes later when her customers stay late to play on the machines she has set up at her business.

She buys the merchandise and ingredients she needs to stock her business from supermarkets, dairy and sausage sellers, and low-cost beverage distributors, which are economically convenient.

With this loan, she will buy merchandise, specifically drinks, ice cream, sugar, tea, noodles, sausages, and yogurt.

One of Inés' goals is to move forward and to keep growing her business, since thanks to it she has the basics her family needs and has been able to advance her children's educations.

Inés lives with her husband, seven year-old twins, a 20 year-old daughter, her mother-in-law, and her mother. Her dream on a personal and family level is to go on vacation with her husband and children. She comments that it has been more than ten years since they went anywhere. On a work level, her goal is to generate more income and a stable economy for her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. She comments that the training workshops have been fundamental to her business as well as to her personal development, as she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments.

Rancagua belongs to the Liberator Bernardo O'Higgins region. It is a modern city that regulates the primary production and export of Chilean fruit and wine. It is also a mining city thanks to its mountain range, which includes the largest subterranean mine in the world, "El Teniente," with 4,500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, specifically drinks, ice cream, sugar, tea, noodles, sausages, and yogurt

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en: Lailanie is 34, married and has five children. She has been selling dried fish for three years and earns about PHP 200 per day.  She aims to increase her profits due to the increased school needs of her children. For that reason, she is asking for financial support of PHP 7,000 to buy a variety of dried fish to sell in the village. She believes that she can improve her income through the loan she requested.

loans.use: to buy a variety of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Clarivel

texts.en: Clarivel is a married woman from the town of Cauayan, in the province of Isabela, Philippines. She and her husband are both farmers who primarily grow rice to sell. Clarivel has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies. Clarivel does her best to improve their business and take care of their two children. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future and to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, a 54-year-old farmer, is married and has eight children: currently, only one of her children is still a student. The rest of her entire family lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province. For the past five years, she has supported her family through rice planting. The main difficulty that affects her income is not enough rainfall which leads to low output. 

Sambath has joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for six loan cycles and has successfully repaid the loans. In a resourceful manner, she has used her past loans to better support her rice-cropping business and to uplift her living conditions. Now, she is one of two female members in a group. Her requested loan amount is 600,000 KHR while the other group member -- a fifth-time borrower -- is seeking 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Sambath is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her cash crop. She expects to multiply her productivity so she can secure her children's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Oeurt's Group

texts.en:
Oeurt is 43 years old and is head of her family but needs to struggle in order to raise her children. She has five children, two of whom are still in school and the other three are paid workers. For the past 10 years, she has been rice farming which is her family's main source of income. 

Oeurt's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was four loan cycles ago. Now, she, as a fifth-time borrower, leads a group comprising two members including herself. She has used her loans wisely to maintain her household especially to provide proper food for her children and she also repaid the entire loans. As the group leader, Oeurt will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She believes that this loan will provide a positive outcome as with the ones before so she can upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Raskmey's Group

texts.en:
Raskmey, from Moung Russey district in Cambodia, is 25 years old and married. She and her husband struggle to support their two young children  via the two hectares of farmland where Raskmey has been growing paddy rice for four years. During his spare time, her husband also catches fish to sell for extra income. 

This is the first loan cycle for Raskmey and her fellow group member who form this group of two. Each of them are applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Raskmey will use her portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to receive a high yield so as she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.ru:
Надежде 64 года, замужем, воспитывает внучку Юлию 10 лет. Надежда  в качестве основного дохода с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Надежды в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы в приплодом, 22 головы мелкого рогатого скота,1 свинья, а  также Надежда обрабатывает 4,0 га земли  с картофелем и зерновыми культурами. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надежда обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи, а также заготовку кормов на зиму.  Доходы от кредита Надежда  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Nadejda is 64 years old, married, and raising her granddaughter Yulia who is 10 years of age. As the main source of income, Nadejda has been raising livestock and growing crops since 1996, having started her business with a sum of 20,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Nadejda's herd currently includes 2 dairy cows with offspring, 22 goats and sheep, and 1 pig. Nadejda also works 4 hectares of land with potatoes and grains. Monthly income from her business amounts to roughly 10,000 som.

In order to continue developing her business, Nadejda has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som to purchase livestock for fattening and resale, and to stock up on animal fodder for the winter. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd so that in time she can build a large house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Roeurn , aged 49 and married, is a rural villager from Battambang province's Moung Russey district. He has two children, a son who is a paid worker and a daughter who attends school. For his children's sake and especially for their daily food, he manages one hectare of rice-paddy farmland and also does cow trading (buying and resale). Having been engaged in these businesses for 10 years, he is able to earn almost 17,000 KHR. 

Roeurn has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has already entirely repaid the previous loans. He has used his loans wisely to sustain his living conditions as well as his businesses. Now, he leads a group of two who are applying for a new loan. He and his co-member are each seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR. With his portion, Roeurn is going to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs for his rice farm. Also, a portion of it will be used for his cow trading business. He hopes that both businesses will earn him a good income so he can improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for labor costs and for his cow-trading business

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 47 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Чолпон  работает учительницей в местной школе  и в качестве дополнительного дохода с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 8,500 сом, использованных на покупку коз. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы в приплодом, 2 лошади, 12 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 20,000 сом. Прибыль позволила Чолпон дать образование своим детям, из которых ее старшая дочь Назира пошла по стопам матери и работает учительницей, сын Алымжан стал военным. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи, а также заготовку кормов на зиму.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы отложить средства на обучение среднего сына Турата, который заканчивает школу и собирается поступать в ВУЗ.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She works as a teacher at a local school, and as an additional source of income has been raising livestock and growing crops since 1995, having started her business with 8,500 som she used to purchase goats. Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, her herd currently includes 2 dairy cows with offspring, 2 horses, and 12 goats and sheep. He monthly business income amounts to 20,000 som. Cholpon's profits have allowed her to provide education to her children. Her eldest daughter Nazira has followed in her mother's footsteps and now works as a teacher, while her son Alymzhan is in the military.

In order to continue developing her business, Cholpon has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening and resale, and to prepare animal fodder to the upcoming winter. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further livestock purchases, so as to amass sufficient funds to pay for education of her middle son Turat, who is finishing high school and preparing to enrol in college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
Phin is a widow from Moung Russey district of Battambang province: she has one son who currently works for others for a fee. She is a farmer who grows rice on three hectares of farmland and cassava on one hectare, the business that she has been in for 20 years. The current business earns her up to 17,000 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, Phin is a sixth loan cycle client while her co-member is a second loan cycle client. Phin has been satisfied with her previous loans which she has completely repaid, very much so as  they have progressively upgraded her living conditions. Now, she and her co-borrower are each seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Phin will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She very much hopes that she can earn more income and maintain a decent standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Las Mujeres Si Podemos Group

texts.es:
El grupo de Mujeres si podemos está conformado por cuatros  socias microempresarias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es María asunción que se dedica a vender frutas en el mercado, esta actividad la inicio con sus  padres cuando era muy joven  es madre soltera con dos hijos y es la manera de sacar a su familia adelante. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de frutas frescas como naranjas, mandarinas, papayas, guayaba para frescos, melón, sandias etc.
Las otras integrantes es Ana Rosa que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, Ana Xiomara tiene una pulpería en su casa y Natalia  vende cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
Mujers Si Podemos (Women, Yes We Can) is a group composed of four resourceful and successful micro entrepreneurs. María is one of them and she engages in selling fruits in the market. She has started this activity when she was very young, working with her parents. She is a single mother of 2, and her activity helps her providing for her family. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy fresh fruits such as oranges, tangerines, papayas, melons, watermelons and guava to prepare fizzy fruit drinks.
The other members of the group are Ana Rosa, who runs a general store in her house; Ana Xiomara, who also runs a general store in her house and Natalia, who sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy oranges, tangerines, papayas, melons, watermelons and guava.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A rural citizen from Moung Russey district, Mom is a married mother of three children. Two of her children are still in school while the third helps with the family's business -- rice farming. Mom provides for her family's basic daily needs via her one hectare of rice cropping farmland with her husband's assistance. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and can earn about 18,000 KHR per day. 

Mom's original loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was three loan cycles ago. With success, she has managed to entirely repay the previous loans which have gradually provided better support for her family's living conditions. Now, she leads a group of two who are applying for a new loan. As the group leader, Mom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes these purchases will increase her crop's productivity and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: Leyla del Socorro de  49 años de edad, casada con tres hijos todos mayores de edad entre la edades comprendidas de 32, 29,26 años todos independientes económicamente. Leyla corresponde al departamento de León lugar que está ubicado en el occidente del país. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. El negocio consiste en vender productos de consumo diario  y en pequeñas cantidades  como arroz, azúcar, aceite jabón, bolsitas de café, bolsitas de champo, caja de fosforo. El negocio surgió como una necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Leyla ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago den tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer la demanda del cliente y obtener mejores ingresos. Leyla del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recurso para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Leyla del Socorro is 49 years old, she is married and she has three adult and economically independent children aged 26, 26 and 32. Leyla lives in León, a department located in the west od the country. She runs a general store in her house, where she sells daily consumable products in small quantities such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, coffee bags, shampoo and matches. She has started this activity in need to have a job to help paying for her household expenses. Leyla has already worked with our institution, proving herself to be responsible with her repayments respecting times and methods. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital and stock up her general store in order to satisfy her customers’ requests and to earn a better income. Leyla del Soccorro is grateful to Kiva Lenders for the support they offer to small retailers with meager means so that the can run a dignified working activity.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, coffee bags, shampoo and matches

loans.name: Janara

texts.ru:
Жанаре  37 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей, младшей из которых 1 годик. Жанара  в качестве основного дохода для семьи  с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Жанары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 телки, ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочной продукции составляет около 2,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жанара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи, а также заготовку кормов на зиму.  Доходы от кредита Жанара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить  средства на увеличение жилплощади.
texts.en:
Janara is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children, the youngest of whom is just 1 year old. As the main source of income for her family, Janara has been raising livestock and growing crops since 1999, having started her business with a sum of 10,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Janara's herd currently includes 3 dairy cows, and her monthly income from sales of milk and dairy products amounts to roughly 2,000 som.

In order to continue developing her business, Janara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening and resale, and also to stock up on animal fodder for the winter. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd, so as to earn enough money for a larger home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Almash

texts.ru:
Алмаш 23 года, замужем, имеет 3-летнего сына и 2-летнюю дочь. Алмаш в качестве основного дохода уже как 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 7,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Алмаш в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 дойные коровы в приплодом, а  также Алмаш обрабатывает 0,29 га земли  с картофелем. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 7,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмаш обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Алмаш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в перспективе купить квартиру.
texts.en:
Almash is 23 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter. As her main source of income, Almash has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 5 years, having started her business with a sum of 7,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Almash's herd presently includes 3 dairy cows with offspring, and she also grows potatoes on 0.29 hectares of land. Her monthly profits from sales of milk and dairy products amount to roughly 7,000 som.

In order to continue developing her business, Almash has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd, and hopes to buy an apartment in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Wendlateenda Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAMSETOU représente le groupe WENDLATEENDA II. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant.  Il a 27 ans.  Il ne va pas à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge. 
Mme vend de  la farine de maïs, des articles féminins (dentele, pagne légers) depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Sénégal pour les pagnes légers et dentele et à Ouaga pour la farine. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 08sacs de maïs pour transformer en farine et 10 complets de pagnes légers.
Mme veut agrandir son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne pouvoir voyager au Sénégal pour  amener plus d’articles, car il faut plus d’argent pour son commerce.
texts.en: Hamsetou represents the Wendlateenda group. She is married and mother to one child, who is 27 years old. He does not go to school and she has one person to support. She has been selling corn flour as well as articles for women (lace and light "pagnes", which are colourful pieces of fabric) for the past four years. She gets her supplies of light "pagnes" and lace from Senegal and the corn from Ouaga. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy eight sacks of corn to make flour and 10 sets of light "pagnes". She wants to expand her business with her profits and her ambition is to be able to travel to Senegal to get more goods, because she needs more money for her business.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of corn for making flour as well as ten sets of light "pagnes".

loans.name: Mahumevo Adjagbo Group

texts.fr: MAHUMEVO ADJAGBO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Ginette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Abéminanchi. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ginette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Ginette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quartoze années environs que, Ginette mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (conserves et spaghettis, savons) à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Ginette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Ginette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Ginette sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUMEVO ADJAGBO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Mahumevo Adjagbo is a group of three people who live in the same district of Benin. The representative of the group, Ginette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 32 years old and married to a man named Abéminanchi. The couple has four children to support and they all attend school. Ginette and her husband live with their children and cover the various household expenses between them. Ginette did not go to school and for the past fourteen years or so has been selling a variety of products (canned foods, spaghetti, soap) from her home and via the distribution system. She is passionate about her business, which enables her to provide for her own needs as well as those of her children. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand, Ginette is requesting a first loan with the other members of the Mahumevo Adjagbo group. This loan will be used to satisfy their customer demand and to make more money.

loans.use: to buy various goods (canned foolds, pasta, toothpaste, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Nounagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUNAGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Virginie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariée à un certain Samson, Virginie est âgée de 38 ans. Virginie est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les diverses charges de la maison. Virginie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Virginie exerce comme activité, la vente des perles dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Virginie vend des nattes. Virginie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Virginie désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Virginie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUNAGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Nounagnon group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group, who is called Virginie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time that the group requests financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the standard of their activity. Married to one Samson, Virginie is 38. She has five children all of whom attend school at her expense. The couple lives together and shares the various household expenses. Virginie did not go to school. For about fifteen years, Virginie has been selling beads in her neighbourhood; this enables her to cover her needs without too much difficulty. On a secondary basis, Virginie sells plaits. She buys her stock in a town in Benin. Hoping to better satisfy her clients, Virginie wishes to reinforce and diversify her activity. With this in view, together with the other members of the Nounagnon group, she requests a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: To purchase beads and plaiting tools.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29, Rath is the married mother of three children. She and her entire family live in Moung Russey district of Cambodia, where rice farming is the common business as the main source of income in her neighborhood as well as for her family. She has managed two hectares of rice-growing farmland for seven years and is able to earn about 27,000 KHR per day. 

In her group of three women, Rath is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) whereas her two co-members are first-time borrowers. Rath has completely repaid her previous loans maintaining a good pace in her business. Now, as the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and insecticide

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a local farmer from Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She has seven children, three of whom are students and the remaining four have their own employment. She supports her household from her two hectares of farmland by growing rice which she has been doing for 20 years. 

This is Touch's third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She leads her group of two in applying for a new loan. She feels confident that she has kept upgrading her lifestyle after the previous loans which she has repaid. Now she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR which is the same amount as her co-member. As the group leader, Touch is going to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so she can set aside some money to buy an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en:
A 58-year-old father from Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia, Vun is a farmer who currently grows rice on three hectares of farmland and cassava on one hectare. He has one son who is a paid worker. After 20 years of being engaged in his business, Vun is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Vun has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles which has helped him with timely support of his business and to gradually  increase his income.  Now, he is the leader of his group of two male members. He and his co-member are each applying for 300,000 KHR. As the  leader, Vun is going to buy fertilizer for his rice farm. He hopes to have a better life than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice farm

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village located in Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia, Mao is a 29-year-old widow and has two sons. Her daily income is from her business selling groceries and from producing hand-made shampoo which she has been doing for five years. 

Mao's group is composed of three female members: this is the fourth loan cycle for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has used her previous loans in a wise manner to maintain her business and her family. Now, she and her co-members are each seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy additional grocery items to sell. She hopes that she will be able to buy grocery items on time and attract more clients in order to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is the married mother of four, three of whom are schoolchildren and one who is a tailor. She and her entire family are from Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia.To overcome the family's hardships, she and her husband grow rice. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. 

Kunthea has never been with VisionFund before. Now, she has formed a group of six people who are seeking a new loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials to build a decent latrine for her household. Kunthea hopes that her new latrine will help to prevent  diseases caused by lack of hygienic practices in her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en: Montaha is a 53-year-old married female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has 4 children and requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for retailing in cosmetics and accessories. In the future she would like to open her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in cosmetics

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Najla is a 36-year-old woman living with her husband in Dair Alla. She is a very dedicated woman and a hard worker and runs a small mini market to help pay the expenses and share the responsibility with her husband. She needs a loan so she can buy new products for her mini market to serve a larger group of customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy new products for her mini market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for making furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Mariette Ayinon (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à Blaise, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mariette Ayinon et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Mariette Ayinon n’a jamais été l’école.  Il y a plus de vingt ans que Mariette Ayinon mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (conserves, fruits et des chaussures) dans sa région. Mariette Ayinon exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mariette Ayinon s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mariette Ayinon sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Djromahuton is a group of three members who are friends. The leader of the group, Mariette Ayinon (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 32 and married to Blaise, a driver. The couple has four children, some of whom go to school and all of whom are dependent. Mariette Ayinon and her husband live together with their children and share the various household expenses. Mariette Ayinon never went to school. For over twenty years she has been selling various products (conserves, fruit, and shoes) in her region. Mariette Ayinon works with passion, which enables her to meet her own and her children's needs. She buys her stock locally. Hoping to come up to her clients' expectations, Mariette Ayinon requests a fourth loan with the other members of her group Djromahuton. This loan will enable them to respond to their customers' needs and make more profit. The previous credits were correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buy conserves, fruit, and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es: Marjorie de 34 años de edad, casada con  2 hijos  menores de edad de 8, 3años.  Ella es originaria del municipio de Achuapa del departamento de León. Marjorie tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa y calzado de segunda mano desde hace  8 años el cual está ubicado en un punto especifico de la localidad. En la actualidad los desafíos que enfrente en los personal y en negocio es que sus esposo por falta de fuentes de trabajo en nuestro país se vio en la necesidad de ir a trabajar en el país de Costa Rica, y eso les  provoca mucha tristeza a sus hijos, la falta de un padre presente físicamente. El negocio consiste en vender ropa y calzado de segunda mano como pantalones, camisas, short, ropa de niño, buzos, capri. La rutina diaria de esta mujer es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias ella habré su negocio a las 8 am y cierra hasta las  4 pm de lunes a domingo. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabaja y surtir su pequeño negocio con la compra de pacas de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano. Marjorie ya ha trabajado con fundación león  2000 y ha demostrados ser responsable con sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Marjorie agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas escasos recursos y países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 34 years old, she has two underage children, eight and three years old. She is a native of the Achuapa municipality, in the León department. Marjorie's economic activity has been, for eight years, selling second-hand clothing and footwear. The establishment is located in a specific location in the locality.

Her current challenges on a personal and on a business level are that her husband, because of the lack of job opportunities in the country, had to go to work in Costa Rica, which causes her children sadness, because their father is not present physically.

The business consists of selling second-hand clothing and footwear such as pants, shirts, shorts, children clothes, sweaters and capri pants. This woman's daily routine is to work eight hours every day. She opens her business at 8:00 am and closes at 4:00 pm, Monday to Sunday. She needs financing to invest in working capital and stock her small business by buying packs of second-hand clothing and footwear.

Marjorie has worked with Fundación León 2000 before and has shown to be responsible, paying in time and the right amounts. Marjorie appreciates the help given by Kiva's investors to limited-resources people and to countries that are economically poor, like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy packs of second-hand clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Boblawend 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA représente le groupe BOBLAWEND 2. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus agé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. Elle se porte bien. Celle qui ne fais plus partie du groupe est la plus jeune,elle est arrêtée à droite de la présidente et tient des pagnes en main. Personne ne va  à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge. 

Mme vend de  beurre de karité, céréale et du tamarin depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants comme Kassoun, Toe, Léo et Nassina. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 08sacs de tamarins, 50 plats de beurre de karité et 07 sacs de maïs.

Mme  réinvesti ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne épauler l’un de ses enfants qui fait la menuiserie et agrandir son commerce en construisant  un magasin de  stockage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamata represents the Boblawend 2 group. She is married with five children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is 12 years old. She is well. The person who is no longer a member of the group is the youngest, she is on the right of the president and is holding fabric in her hand. None of them attend school and she has five people dependent on her.

She has been selling shea butter, cereals, and tamarinds for five years. She buys her stock in the neighbouring villages such as Kassoun, Toe, Léo and Nassina. Her clients are men and women.

She would like to buy 8 sacks of tamarinds, 50 bowls of shea butter and 7 sacks of maize.

Mrs. Salamata reinvests her profits in her business. She aims to help one of her children who is a carpenter and expand her business by building a shop for storage.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of tamarinds, 50 bowls of shea butter and 7 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es: Ponciano de 49 años actualmente es viudo y tiene la suerte de tener a sus hijos ya mayores y capaces de afrontar la vida de manera independiente. Con esfuerzo pudo concretar una casa de material noble. Como todo un experto en la actividad de la siembra y cosecha del cacao, él tiene en sus terrenos un exceso de crecimiento de malas yerbas e impide que el cacao crezca y sea cosechado en optimas condiciones para poder contemplar sus ganancias sin inconvenientes. Tuvo muchas dificultades a lo largo de sus 30 años como agricultor del cacao y en esta ocasión necesitará contratar personal externo para realizar una limpieza natural de sus árboles y así evitar que la calidad de su producto disminuya. Asimismo tiene en mente incrementar más cultivos de productos orgánicos similares. Con el préstamo número 18 se siente confiado y comenta muy gustoso que le entretiene reunirse con sus compañeros de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 soles ya podrá contactarse con la mayor cantidad de jornaleros de su zona y realizar la limpieza de sus terrenos.
texts.en: Ponciano is 49 years old and a widower.  He is fortunate in that his children are already adults and able to face life independently.  Through hard work, he was able to build a house from solid materials.  Ponciano is a real expert in sowing and harvesting cacao.  He currently has a lot of weeds growing on his land which prevents the cacao from growing and being harvested in optimal conditions.  This means he faces difficulties in making a good profit for his crops.  Ponciano has experienced many difficulties throughout his 30 years working as a cacao grower and on this occasion he needs to hire day laborers  to naturally weed his trees so that he can avoid experiencing a fall in the quality of his produce.  He also plans to grow more similar organic products.  With his 18th loan, Ponciano feels confident and comments very happily that he enjoys meeting with his fellow community bank members.  Ponciano will use his 1,500 soles to hire as many workers from his area as he can, to weed his land.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La  socia Sebastiana pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos y verduras como zanahorias,lechuga,tomates entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura ella siembra lo que son maíz y papa, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a sus negocios ,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.


La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sebastiana belongs to the 'Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata' community bank.  She continues working in her business selling dried grains and vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, tomatoes, etc.  She also continues farming, growing corn and potatoes.  Sebastiana has been in these businesses for years and they are doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in each day.  She is a cheerful and responsible person and this is how she provides for her family.

Sebastiana is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and manure for her farm.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her farm

loans.name: Clara Sylvana

texts.es:
Clara tiene 19 años, se considera una persona responsable, emprendedora y muy colaboradora en las actividades que le designen. Clara vive con su madre y su hija en Salcedo.

Clara es estudiante y también con su madre se dedican a la crianza de animales como conejos, cuyes, gallinas entre otros, negocio que le ayuda a sustentar sus estudios, los gastos de su hija y de su hogar, Clara es muy emprendedora quiere incrementar sus ingresos para lo cual solicita un crédito en Fodemi que invertirá en la construcción de galpones para los conejos y los cuyes, también invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera para entrar en el negocio de la venta de leche.

Clara sueña en tener variedad de animales de granja para la crianza y venta, con lo cual podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Clara is 19 years old.  She believes herself to be a responsible, entrepreneurial person who is very helpful in carrying out work that she is given to do.  Clara lives with her mother and daughter in Salcedo.

Clara is a student.  Together with her mother she also raises animals such as rabbits, guinea pigs, hens, etc.  This business helps her to support her own education and to cover her daughter's expenses and household expenses.  Clara is very entrepreneurial.  She would like to increase her income and so she is requesting a loan from Fodemi to invest in building cages for rabbits and guinea pigs.  She will also invest in buying a dairy cow so that she can start selling milk.

Clara dreams of having a range of farmyard animals to raise and sell.  This will enable her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build cages for rabbits and guinea pigs.  She will also invest in buying a dairy cow so that she can start selling milk.

loans.name: Silvio David

texts.es:
SILVIO DAVID tiene 49 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

 SILVIO DAVID se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, balanceado. Las compras las realizará en Mocache y en Ventanas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta paracticar el deporte.
texts.en:
Silvio David is 49 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and their two children in the city of Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Silvio David is a member of the '5 de septiembre' community bank which is located in Los Plátanos, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group farm and raise livestock.

Silvio David grows corn and rice.  He also raises and sells chickens.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer and nutritionally-balanced feed.  He makes his purchases in Mocache and in Ventanas.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy everything he needs for his farming.  His dream is to buy a plot of land to grow crops on.  The challenges that he faces are pest infestations.  In his free time, he enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer and nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar, paquetería y confitería, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que arrienda un local y trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 9ºº hasta las 20ºº horas.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en diferentes supermercados, distribuidoras, a vendedores que llegan a su negocio ofreciendo productos lácteos y cecinas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará helados, bebidas, papas fritas, lácteos y cecinas.
Una de las metas de de Elena es seguir creciendo como hasta ahora, surtir su negocio lo que más pueda y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
Elena vive junto a su hija de veinte años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es ver que su hija termine sus estudios y sea una gran profesional y así ver su tarea cumplida con su hija, y a nivel laboral tener un local propio donde pueda tener bien abastecido su negocio y tener más clientela y generar mayores ingresos.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitió invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the 'Forjadoras de sueños' community bank which is located in the city of Rancagua.  She has been running a general store / notions store / candy store for four years.  She says that she rents her premises and works from Monday to Saturday, from 9.00am to 8.00pm.  She buys the merchandise that she needs for her business in different supermarkets and from suppliers and sellers who come to her premises offering dairy products and pork sausages for sale at low prices, which is financially convenient.  Elena will use her loan to buy iced treats, drinks, chips, dairy products and pork sausages.

One of Elena's goals is to continue growing her business as she has up to now.  She will stock her business as much as she can and meet the needs of her customers.  This will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Elena lives together with her 20-year-old daughter who is studying.  Her dreams for her family are to see her daughter finish her education and become a successful professional.  This will see her duty towards her daughter completed.  On a work level, she would like to own her own business premises where she can have a well-stocked business and more customers, and thus make more income.

Elena is very grateful and happy for the opportunity she has been given by Fondo Esperanza as it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs who belong to her community bank as they share different activities and interests which has allowed her to enjoy her time with them.  As regards the training sessions that they receive during their meetings, she has learned how to better run her business.

Rancagua is located in Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city which controls the main fruit and wine production and exportation process  in Chile.  It is also a mining city and its mountain range is home to the world's largest underground mine "El Teniente" which has 4,500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy iced treats, drinks, chips, dairy products and pork sausages

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de artesanía en mimbre (figuras a base de estructuras de fierro y de madera, además de pequeños y grandes accesorios), desde hace 15 años. Comenta que trabaja con un puesto en su casa de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra mimbre a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente Mimbre, para realizar sus figuras y lo que pida el cliente.
Una de las metas de Jacqueline son crecer con su rubro y poder vender cerca de la carretera, ya que esta artesanía se caracteriza por venderse de esta forma, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Jacqueline vive junto a su marido y 2 hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su propio taller de mimbre y seguir surgiendo como una microempresaria ya que le gusta mucho su rubro y la ha ayudado económicamente para sacar a su familia adelante y a sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the communal bank "Forjadoras de Sueños" [Dream Makers], in the city of Rancagua. She has been making wicker handicrafts (figures made of metal and wood, with additional, small and big accessories) for 15 years. She mentions that she has a stall at home, from Monday to Sunday. Her opening times depend on her availability.

She buys her merchandise from different distributors and establishments where she finds wicker at a low cost, which is good economically. With the loan she will only buy wicker, to make her figures and whatever her customers order. One of Jacqueline's goals is to expand her business and to be able to sell close to the highway, because this handicraft is usually sold this way. In this way, she can think of having a better quality of life.

Jacqueline lives together with her husband and two children, 19 and 16 years old, who are now attending school. Her dreams, from a professional perspective, are to have her own wicker workshop and to continue progressing as a micro entrepreneur. She likes her business very much and it has helped her economically, so she has been able to get her family and children ahead.

She feels very happy and thankful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza, because it has helped her invest in her business. Besides, she feels comfortable with other entrepreneurs' company at the communal bank, because they share different activities and interests. Regarding the training sessions during the meetings, she has learned to manage her business in a better way.

Rancagua is located in the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region. It is a modern city, which regulates the main productive and export activities of viticulture and fruit growing in Chile. It is also a mining city, because the largest subterranean mine in the world, "El Teniente", with 4500-km long tunnels, can be found in its mountains.

loans.use: to buy wicker, in order to make figures and other things that her customers might order.

loans.name: Danilo Alberto

texts.es:
DANILO ALBERTO tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

DANILO ALBERTO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Las compras las realizará en Mocache.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es seguir trabajando y comprar una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar pequeños arreglos en la casa.
texts.en:
Danilo Alberto is 35 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children in the city of Ventanas, in los Ríos province.  

Danilo Alberto is a member of the '5 de septiembre' community bank which is located in Los Plátanos, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group farm and raise livestock.

Danilo Alberto grows corn and rice.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and liquid weed killer.  He makes his purchases in Mocache.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy everything he needs for his crops.  His dream is to continue working and to buy a house.  The challenges that he faces are crop diseases.  In his free time, he enjoys making small repairs to his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es: Ruth del Socorro de   32 años de edad, Madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad de  17,14, años. Originaria del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, una ciudad tranquila con gente muy acogedora. Ruth tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace 10 años que desempeña dicha actividad. En la actualidad los desafíos y problemas que presenta en el negocio es la falta de capital para invertir al negocio. Su negocio consiste en vender ropa variada como cosmeticos  pantalones, vestidos, short, faldas, blusas, ropa interior. en la foto observamos a Ruh con unos de los productos que ofrece que son cosmeticos. La rutina diaria de Ruth del socorro es salir a vender a las calle de forma ambulante unas  10 horas diarias para colocar sus mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener unos ingresos para poder subsistir con sus pequeños hijos. Ruth ya ha trabajado con fundación  y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Ruth del Socorro agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recurso  para tener un medio de trabajo digno. En un país con tantas carencia  de fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ruth del Socorro is a 32-year-old single mother with two children, ages 14 and 17. She is originally from the department of León, which is located in the west of the country. León is known for being a tourist area, a calm city with very friendly people. Ruth has made a living selling general merchandise for the past 10 years. Currently, the challenge and problem of her business is the lack of capital to invest in the business. Her business consists of selling various clothing items, such as cosmetics, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, shirts, and underwear. In the photo, we can see Ruth with one of the types of products she offers, cosmetics.

Ruth del Socorro's daily routine is to go out and sell merchandise on the street for about 10 hours every day in order to reach both fixed and potential clients. She started her business due to a need for income to survive with her small children. Ruth has already worked with the foundation, and she has proved herself to be responsible by making her payments on time and in the right amounts. Ruth del Socorro is grateful for the help which Kiva investors give to people with limited resources, in order for them to have a decent livelihood in a country which sorely lacks job opportunities.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandise such as cosmetics, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 40 years old. She is married and has 7 children. Eugenia is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Eugenia cultivates coconuts to sell. Eugenia has been in business for 15 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Eugenia joined GDMPC. Eugenia is requesting a loan of 7,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Martina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Martina de  54 anos de edad, madre soltera del departamento de león, tiene dos hijos de los cuales  el de 17 anos esta bajo su responsabilidad actualmente esta estudiando. Ella tiene por actividad económica el servicio de costura desde hace 13 anos que se desempeña en dicha actividad. Negocio que surgió  porque a ella le gusta el corte y la confección y decidió aprender, también para tener una forma de ingresos para sacar adelantes a sus hijos como madre soltera que no cuenta con ninguna otra ayuda económica. En la actualidad ella enfrentaba algunos problemas como es el fallecimiento de su anciano padre.   El cual ella tenía bajo su cargo. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Martina esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y poder comprar productos como telas, hilos, carretes, cintas, botones, broches previendo que viene la temporada fuerte para su negocio como es las promociones escolares y navidad en los meses de Noviembre y Diciembre. Martina agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martina is a 54-year-old single mother from the department of León. She has two children, one of which is still under her care; he is 17 years old and is currently studying. She has been working as a seamstress for 13 years. This business emerged because she likes dressmaking and decided to learn, and she also wanted to have a means of income to ensure her children's success. As a single mother, she does not count on anyone else for financial support. She is currently facing various problems, such as the death of her elderly father, who had been under her care. Her business is located in her home.

Martina is asking for a loan to invest in working capital and to buy products such as fabric, thread, bobbins, ribbon, buttons, and brooches. She anticipates that the busiest season for her business is coming, with school graduations and Christmas in the months of November and December.

Martina is grateful for the help which Kiva investors give to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy products such as fabric, thread, bobbins, ribbon, buttons, and brooches.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in working capital by buying and selling milk and producing more junket

loans.name: Cristina Alejandra

texts.es:
CRISTINA ALEJANDRA tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y con el conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

CRISTINA ALEJANDRA se dedica a la siembra, además a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas,  urea, líquido para la maleza. Las compras lo hace en Quinsaloma.

El sueño es comprar un terreno, Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Cristina Alejandra is 20 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has one child. She lives with her spouse and her son in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the "5 de septiembre" Solidarity Group, which is located in the community of Los Plátanos in the canton of Ventanas. They make their living in agriculture and raising livestock. 

Cristina Alejandra cultivates land and raises animals. She is asking for a loan to buy insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer. She does her shopping in Quinsaloma.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges which she faces are diseases in the crops. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and do housework.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida, 55, is happily married to William. She is engaged in buying and selling fish in the village. She sells in the market every market day (Thursday and Sunday) to increase her earnings. She aspires to live a good life through her business. But, without capital, her business will not perform well, and she will definitely not achieve a good income and a good life. Therefore, Nida is seeking additional capital for use in her business. A loan of PHP 13,000 will be used to buy more fish and 2 bigger Styrofoam containers. She believes that, through the loan, she can improve her income and attain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy more fish and 2 bigger Styrofoam containers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She currently resides in Dugo, where she manages a general store. She is thankful that she has been earning PHP 500 each day, which is used for their daily needs, and she is aiming for a higher income in order to save for the education of her children. To make her business more profitable, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, breads, milk, sugar and beverages. Hopefully, the loan will be a great help in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, breads, milk, sugar and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro bazar, paquetería y artesanía, en este último rubro ella fabrica diferentes modelos de monederos para la venta en su local, desde hace 8 meses. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 9ºº hasta las 20ºº horas, arrienda un local para ofrecer su mercadería surtida a su clientela, que abarca de ropa, articulos para el hogar y librería.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras, galerías de artesanía, comercializadoras e importadoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará pañuelos, aros, chapas, articulos de librería, hilo, agujas, billeteras, vitrinas para mostrar su mercadería.
Una de las metas de Maria es independizarse, tener otro local, ya que por el momento trabaja con su hermana, así con esto generaría mayores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida y una ayuda para le educación de sus hijos.
Maria vive junto a sus dos hijos de 26 y 22 años de edad, el mayor esta terminando sus estudios y el menor se encuentra trabajando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es crecer con su negocio e instalarse con un local independiente y ofrecer su  mercadería a su clientela, y a nivel familiar ver a sus hijos con una profesión y ver su tarea cumplida con ellos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Forjadores de sueños" Communal Bank in the city of Rancagua.

For eight months, she has made a living selling merchandise, such as stationery and artisan products, in a general store. She makes various types of purses to sell as artisan products in her store. She works from Monday to Saturday from 9 a.m until 8 p.m. She rents a space to sell merchandise to her clients, which consists of clothing, home goods, and stationery.

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago from various distributors, artisan galleries, vendors and importers at a low cost, so that it is financially convenient.

With this loan she will buy scarves, earrings, studs, stationery, thread, needles, purses, and display cabinets to display her merchandise.

One of Maria's goals is to become independent and to open another store, because at the moment she works with her sister. This would bring in more income, as well as a better quality of life and help with the children's education.

Maria lives with her two children, ages 22 and 26. Her elder son is finishing his studies, and the younger one is working. Her dreams in terms of her work are to grow her business and set up a local independent shop to offer her merchandise to her clients. As for her family, her dream is to see her children working and to fulfill her duties with them.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity which Fondo Esperanza has given her, because it has allowed her to invest in her business. Furthermore, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs of the communal bank, because they all have different activities and interests, which has allowed her to have a moment of distraction.

Rancagua is located in the region of El Libertador Bernando O'Higgins. It is a modern city which controls the most important production and exportation of produce and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city, due to the fact that the largest underground mine in the world, "El Teniente", is located in its range, with 4.500 km of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy scarves, earrings, studs, stationery, thread, needles, purses, and display cabinets to display her merchandise.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married with 3 children. Rebecca is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. Rebecca is a farmer and has a rice field to earn a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. Rebecca has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 mos. In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her coconut field some day.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer

loans.name: Genel

texts.en: Genel, 27 years old, is a married entrepreneur in Sebasi, Clarin, and has 3 children. He earns income from his banana production business. It has been operating for almost 3 years, and he earns 5,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, he is borrowing the amount of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit, which he joined in 2008, in order to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young plants to raise. He is hopeful about the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young plants to raise.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and has five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Joyce owns a plot of farm land, planting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Joyce been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Joyce's plan is to save her returns in order to expand their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is a widow and has one child. She is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. Daphne is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. Daphne has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. 

Daphne has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Daphne hopes to expand her coconut field.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
