This is Flora, 67, a resident of Batasan in the Philippines. She is married to Agustin and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Flora maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer's prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flora hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es:
Desde hace unos años, Diana inició el negocio de la venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos y con esto ha podido aportar económicamente en su hogar ya que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para sostener los gastos de su hijo de 7 años de edad. Con su negocio su familia ha podido tener una mejor calidad de vida y aunque aún persisten las dificultades económicas, se han podido ir superando poco a poco. Gracias a que tiene muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para responder por ellos, Diana busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal para responder a los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Diana started her business of selling personal products through catalogs some years ago and this has helped her contribute financially to the household since her husband’s income was not sufficient to support her seven year old child. Through her business her family has been able to have a better quality of life and although the financial difficulties persist, she has been able to overcome them little by little.

Because she has lots of orders from her customers but does not have enough capital to fulfill them, Diana is seeking a loan that will permit her to buy personal products in order to meet the orders that her customers have placed.

Her dream is to be able to give her household a better quality of life and better financial opportunities in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy personal products in order to fulfill the orders that her customers have placed

loans.name: Jorge Hernando

texts.es:
Jorge desde joven aprendió la actividad de la fabricación de calzado gracias a que un amigo suyo le enseñó la actividad y comenzó a trabajar en empresas referentes a esto. Durante muchos años trabajó para una empresa hasta que un día por recorte de personal se quedó sin empleo, entonces con su liquidación compró una máquina básica que necesitaba y decidió montar su propio taller de fabricación de calzado en su hogar. Pese a no contar con mucho capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir sacando poco a poco este negocio, además de que gracias al acompañamiento de su esposa que siempre trabaja a su lado logró superar las dificultades económicas y así generar los ingresos para el hogar con este taller. Buscando responder a unos grandes pedidos que tiene, Jorge busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como cuero, suelas, plantillas, cordones, pegas, entre otros y responder a los pedidos de los clientes.

Su sueño es poder continuar con esta actividad y lograr tener un taller más amplio para generar empleo y también mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge learned how to make shoes as a young man thanks to a friend, who taught him the trade. He began working in a shoe factory. For many years, he worked for a company until one day, due to cuts in personnel, he found himself without work. Then, with his severance pay, he bought a basic machine that he needed and decided to start his own shoe-making workshop in his home. Despite not having much capital, his hard work enabled him to get ahead, little by little. Thanks to his wife, who always worked by his side, he was able to overcome economic difficulties and thus earn an income from his business to maintain his home.

Now Jorge wants to fill some large orders he has and is seeking a loan in order to buy materials, such as leather, soles, insoles, shoe laces, glue and other items, and meet the demands of his customers.

His dream is to be able to continue with his business and have a larger workshop and to generate jobs and also improve the economic situation of his family.

loans.use:
to purchase materials, such as leather, soles, insoles, shoe laces and 
glue, among other items, to fill orders from his customers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 43, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Casiano and a mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evangeline operates a food stall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evangeline hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Farming has been the primary source of income for Richard's family. Due to his hard work and determination in life, he is able to buy hogs and has raised them well. Gained profits from his livestock business were used to cover all of his family's household expenses, as well as the education of his three children. Richard currently is raising two swine to be fattened. He plans to acquire additional piglets to raise, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000. He knows that this financial support he is requesting will help him attain his goals in life and help with his livestock and farming business.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for their daily maintenance

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is married to Denia, who is a businesswoman.The couple have been blessed with six children. Four of their children are married, while the other two are still studying. 

Felipe is a hog raiser and farmer within his local community. By this time, he has raised many hogs for fattening: two sows and 10 piglets. He is very grateful because whenever he gets rid of some of his hogs, he immediately replaces them with new hogs. With his strategies in his livestock business, he is able to obtain more hogs to raise. Since his livestock business has grown, he is also in need of greater capital to supply his livestock needs, such as hog feed and vitamins to ensure them proper growth. Thus, he decided to seek a bigger loan amounting to PHP 40,000. He hopes that his business will continue to grow so that he could let his two children finish their studies and be able to give them a comfortable lifestyle someday.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vitamins for raising hogs

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene una tienda general desde hace unos 3 años con la cual genera ingresos para contribuir económicamente en su hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus hijos. Como la situación económica de la familia estaba en muy malas condiciones, Rosa decidió montar este negocio y poder ayudar en el hogar a superar esta dificultad, y desde entonces con su tienda ha podido ir mejorando los ingresos de la familia y mejorar la calidad de vida en el hogar. Su mayor dificultad es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder responder a las ventas de sus clientes, que cada vez vienen creciendo; sin embargo ahora que tiene la oportunidad, Rosa busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y así aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder ser la propietaria del local donde tiene su negocio y también poder mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa has had a general store for three years, which generates income to help with household expenses. She lives with her husband and children. As her family’s economic situation was very difficult, Rosa decided to start this business so she could help at home and overcome their financial problems. Since then, her store has been able to help improve family income and quality of life in the home. Her greatest difficulty is not having enough capital to meet the demands of her customers, who are expanding. Now, however, that she has the opportunity, she is applying for a loan in order to purchase basic household supplies and stock her store so she can offer a greater variety of products and increase her sales.

Rosa’s dream is to be proprietor of a space where she can have her store. She also wants to improve the quality of life in her home.

loans.use: to buy household supplies and stock her store, so she can offer a greater variety of products and increase sales.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 45, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Armin and the mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna offers manicure and pedicure services. She already has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She does home service. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edna hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
This is Felicisima. She previously accessed an 31,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Felicisima dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She aspires to attain a good position in her direct selling business and to be able to have a kiosk someday where she can display her herbal supplement items.  She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to share her own story of God’s love and provision in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for herbal supplement products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is hardworking wife and responsible mother to her two children. She has run a restaurant for more than 15 years, as well as a retail store. She is thankful because she and her husband have been able to support their household expenses and the education of their children. Her spouse's occupation is a private bodyguard.

Juvelyn would like to increase her sales and profit so she could let her two children finish their studies. Aside from the restaurant and retail store, Juvelyn is also selling charcoal. Gained profits from her businesses were used to cover all of their household expenses and school fees for her children. Juvelyn would like to request additional working capital in the amount of PHP 30,000, thus allowing her to buy more stocks of ingredients such as vinegar, oil, soy sauce and some raw meat and vegetables for her restaurant. She hopes that through this loan amount she could further expand her restaurant so that she could let her children finish their studies and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients such as vinegar, oil, soy sauce and some raw meat and vegetables for her restaurant

loans.name: Khang

texts.en:
Khang was born in 1992. He lives in Bac Ninh. He lis a business administration major at Hanoi University business and technology (http://hubt.edu.vn/Home/). His course lasts four years and he will be graduated in 2015. 

Khang’s family has four members. He is the first person in his family to graduate high school and have a higher education. His parents sell petrol and wood to earn a living. His family’s income is about 8,000,000 VND. His mother is Thoa, who sits next to him in this picture. She is also a member of SEDA’s credit program. 

Khang has a passion with his major. He wants to follow it to the end of this university’s course. Khang plans to work in the capital of Hanoi or the province of Bac Ninh within next five to 10 years. He understands that continued learning gives him knowledge and opportunities to get a high-paid job. 

He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for his studying tools. Besides lacking studying tools, he has other difficulties such as his living fees and transportation fees. 

Khang wants to tell people that he appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has supported the education of Khang and of Vietnam’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for his studying tools

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana es muy trabajadora y esto le ha permitido sacar su propio salón de belleza adelante, el cual montó hace 12 años después de haber estudiado una técnica en corte y cepillado del cabello. Con este negocio ha podido aportar económicamente en su hogar para que su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida, y con mucho esfuerzo ha venido superando poco a poco las dificultades de capital que tiene. En un principio el negocio estaba muy mal dotado, pues Adriana no contaba con el dinero suficiente para poder dotarlo bien, y ahora después de tantos años esforzándose, Adriana busca un préstamo para comprar una silla de peluquería, y una vitrina y productos de belleza para ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita generar mayores ingresos para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adriana is very hardworking and this has enabled her to succeed in her beauty salon, which she opened 12 years ago after having studied hair cutting and styling techniques. With this business, she has been able to contribute economically to her household so that her family can have a better quality of life. With a great deal of effort, she has been overcoming her difficulties in acquiring capital, little by little. At first, her business was poorly equipped because she did not have enough money to furnish it well. Now, after many years of working, Adriana is seeking a loan in order to purchase a hairdressing chair, a cabinet and beauty produces, so she can offer better service to her clients 

Adriana’s dream is to move her business ahead so that it will generate more income. Thus she will be able to provide her family a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a hairdressing chair, a cabinet and beauty products so she can offer her clients better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernando se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la actividad de la agricultura la cual aprendió por parte de su padre desde muy niño para trabajar a su lado. Con un cultivo de café y otro de caña de azúcar, genera los ingresos que necesita en su hogar para sostener los gastos de su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, y pese a que siempre ha tenido dificultades económicas y de capital para el negocio su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir poco a poco creciendo y mejorando sus cultivos. Actualmente tiene una gran producción de café que por dificultades del clima está perdiendo, y como no cuenta con el capital suficiente a Hernando no le queda otra opción que buscar un préstamo para comprar abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas para sacar adelante su cultivo de café y preservarlo de los fuertes climas.

Su sueño es ampliar los cultivos que tiene y así mejorar sus ingresos pára ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hernando has spent most of his life working in agriculture which he learned when he was a very young boy from his father working at his side. With a crop of coffee and another of sugar cane, he earns the income needed to pay the household expenses of his wife and two children who are 14 and 16 years old, and although he always has financial difficulties of cash for his business his efforts have permitted him to expand and improve his crops little by little.

Currently he has a large production of coffee that because of weather conditions he is losing, and as he does not have enough capital Hernando has no other option but to seek a loan in order to buy fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides to forge ahead with his coffee crop and protect it from the strong weather.

His dream is to expand his crops and thus improve his income in order to give his family a better quality of life and better opportunities in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides in order to forge ahead with his coffee crop and protect it against the strong weather.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food supplements to resell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel aims to become a successful businessman some day. He is married and has one child. He plans to strengthen his business so he can save some amount for the bright future of his child.

Joel has run his hog-raising business for three years. According to him, farming has been the main source of income of the families in his area. Joel and his wife work together to generate sufficient funds for their family's basic necessities and maintenance of their four hectares of corn field.

Joel is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000, allowing him to buy hog feed and vaccines to improve the growth of his hogs. He is hoping for the approval of his requested loan amount so he can strengthen his livestock business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en: Darlene is from the Mabini Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old and is married with three children. Darlene owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 10,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Darlene joined GDMPC. Darlene is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle in order to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Rosana is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Rosana cultivates bananas and coconuts. Rosana has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosana joined GDMPC. Rosana is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty items for beautician business

loans.name: Myrlinda

texts.en: Myrlinda is a 40-year-old single woman. She lives in Guba, Clarin, where her wide array of cassava production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 34 years old. She normally receives 7,000 PHP a month from her farming. In 2010, Myrlinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase manure to increase production. When the crop gets harvested, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business area, so she can earn a higher income to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase manure to increase production.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 31 years old, married and has one child. To earn a living, he does farming. Stephen has been farming for 6 years. He also owns a green grocer for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Stephen has learned how to save his money because he has been trained in financial management.

Stephen hopes to expand his farm in the future. He also desires to open many outlets of his grocery business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water pump.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Hugo David

texts.es:
HUGO DAVID tiene 22 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

HUGO DAVID se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es construir una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Hugo David, age 22, is in a common-law marriage and has no children.  He lives with his wife in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the 5 de Septiembre communal bank, which is located in the Los Plátanos area of the Ventanas canton.  The members work in agriculture and with livestock.  Hugo David grows corn and raises animals.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  His dream is to build a house.  The challenges he faces are diseases.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Agricultoras Group

texts.es:
Agricultoras es un grupo de tres personas emprendedoras que tienen el mismo objetico que es el de triunfar y mejorar su calidad de vida, de este grupo Silvia es la presidenta ya que se destaca por ser una persona responsable, sociable, amable y muy activa. Silvia vive con su madre y su hija en Salcedo. En la fotografía Silvia es la señora del medio.

Silvia y sus ayudantes se dedican al sembrío de tomate, negocio que ha ido creciendo constantemente gracias al esfuerzo de Silvia y ha servido como sustento para su familia. Silvia necesita seguir sembrando su terreno es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que será invertido en la compra de fungicidas, abonos y para preparar al terreno para un nuevo sembrío de tomates. Al igual que silvia sus compañeras necesitan sembrar sus terrenos para tener una buena producción y salir adelante con sus familias.

Silvia sueña en comprar un terreno grande para construir un invernadero más grande y que sus productos sean de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Agricultoras is a group of three enterprising people who have the same objective, to triumph and to improve their quality of life.  Silvia is the president of this group.  She stands out for being a responsible, social, kind, and very active person.  Silvia lives with her mother and her daughter in Salcedo.  Silvia is the lady in the middle in the photo.

Silvia and her helpers grow tomatoes.  The business has been growing continually, thanks to Silvia’s effort.  It has served to support her family.  Silvia needs to continue planting her land, and that is why she is requesting a loan from Fodemi.

She will use the loan to buy fungicides and natural fertilizer to prepare the land for a new tomato crop.  Like Silvia, her colleagues need to plant their land in order to have a good production and to get ahead with their families.

Silvia dreams of buying a large piece of land in order to build a larger greenhouse, and she dreams of having good quality products.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and natural fertilizer to prepare the land for a new tomato crop.

loans.name: Hugo Santos

texts.es:
El señor Hugo Santos esta unido, tiene 21 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual aun no estudia, se dedica ala tejeduría, iniciando este trabajo con su papá y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica ala costura.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, ya que quiere tener suficiente capital para tener mas tejido de cortes, espera tener buen resultado de la inversión que esta realizando.
texts.en:
Hugo Santo is 21 years old, and he is in a relationship.  He only attended six years of elementary school.  He has one child, who does not attend school yet.  

Hugo Santos is a weaver.  He started this work with his father, and he has five years of experience so far.  He has his wife’s support, and she is a seamstress.

He is requesting a loan to buy different types and colors of yarn.  He wants to have enough capital to have more woven traditional garments.  He hopes to have a good result from the investment he is making.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Rosa Liliana

texts.es:
ROSA LILIANA tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad. Vive con el esposo y con el hijo en la ciudad de ventanas Provioncia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

ROSA LILIANA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Las compras las realizará en Mocache.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es hacer la casa y ayudar a los hijos en los estudios. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Rosa Liliana, age 31, is in a common-law marriage and has a 14 year old son.  She lives with her husband and son in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the 5 de Septiembre communal bank in the Los Plátanos area of the Ventanas canton.  The members devote themselves to farming and raising animals.

Rosa Liliana grows corn and raises animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.  She will make her purchases in Mocache.

With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for the crops.  Her dream is to build her house and to help her son with his education.  The challenges she faces are diseases.  In her free time she likes to do the household chores and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is engaged in a livestock business wherein he fattens and raises pigs. 

He is separated and blessed with seven children. Three of his children have settled into marriage, while another three are farmers, and his youngest child is still studying. 

Eduardo said that being a single parent is quite hard because of greater responsibilities. But as time passed by, he has realized that it's a part of life.

Eduardo would like to keep improving his farming and livestock business, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 that he will use to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccine for his pigs.  He hopes that through this financial assistance, he can raise his hogs well, so he can sell them for a greater price.

He believes that his profit will serve the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccine for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sayhua” en la ciudad  de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, venta de comestibles, venta de verduras y venta de muebles, algunos socios se dedica a elaborar muebles de madera y otros trabajan para el estado en el sector educación como profesores. La socia Beatriz nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de la socia Beatriz es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio de la crianza de animales y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Beatriz desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuyes y alimento. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Sayhua communal bank in the city of Urubamba in the Cusco departmant.  This communal bank is comprised of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead.  With their daily effort, they are looking to give their children a better future.  The members’ businesses are, for example, selling meals, selling food, selling vegetables, and selling furniture.  Some of the members make wooden furniture and others work as teachers for the state.

Beatriz was born in the city of Urubamba, and she lives in the city where she was born.  Beatriz raises small animals like guinea pigs.  She has had the business of raising animals for several years, and it is going great thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Beatriz wishes to buy merchandise like guinea pigs and feed.

The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them, and they pledge to make their payments 

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province belonging to Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas. It’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, historic city center, scenery, history and for being a charming city in the southern region of the country. Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 38, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a conductor. She and her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagros operates a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Milagros hopes to give her children a good education and a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her store.

loans.name: Mcdonald

texts.en: Macdonald used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a goat which he sold and made a good profit.  With the additional income, he was able to vaccinate his livestock.  He has requested for another loan of 30, 000 KES to buy a goat and a cow.

loans.use: To buy a goat and a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 41, who is a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Ariel, a taxi driver, and a mother to her children. Imelda manages her own household while operating her market stall. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. Imelda sells fruits and vegetables in the community market. She buys large quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells it by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Imelda earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales. 

Imelda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Imelda dreams of giving her children a quality education and hopes to have a good future through all her hard work on her business. Imelda faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old, married and has two children. He has been farming for nine years. He mainly grows maize, tomatoes and beans. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. His desire is to practice large-scale farming in the future.  

Stephen needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy pipes for watering his farm.

loans.use: To buy pipes for watering his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads, and embroidery thread for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making delicious dishes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old. She is married with four children and lives in Sebasi, Clarin. For the past six years, Josephine has cultivated coconuts to sell and she usually earns 5,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2008.

Josephine is requesting a 5,500 PHP loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. When her crop is harvested, Josephine will use the revenue to expand her business so that she can earn more income and sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to raise to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sabina Maria

texts.es: SabinaSabina de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, todo empezó ya hace 6 años cuando comenzaron ella y su esposo a la venta y distribución de sacos de arroz. Ahora también están comenzando un puesto de venta de encebollado la cual le va muy bien por lo que espera tener un local propio para vender sus encebollados ella se levanta a preparar sus encebollados a la 4.00am y los sale a vender a las 6:30am.Con el préstamo ella va a comprar cosas para la venta de encebollados como: sillas, arroz,mesas
texts.en:
Sabina Maria is married and has two adult children. 

It all began six years ago when she and her husband began selling and distributing sacks of rice. Now they are opening a stall to sell encebollados [soup usually made with tuna or steak, cassava, tomatoes and onions] which is going very well which is why they are hoping to have their own facility in order to sell the encebollados. She gets up at 4:00AM and leaves to sell them at 6:30AM. 

With the loan she is going to buy items for the sale of encebollados such as rice, and tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy rice, chairs and tables for her encebollado business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 42 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, he sells livestock: goats, sheep and cows. He has been in the business for seven years. He also sells charcoal for additional income. He was able to start the business after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya.
Julius hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested for 30,000 KES to buy goats, sheep and cows.

loans.use: To buy goats, sheep, and cows

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora. She runs a food stall and previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Flora is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase the raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. The profits from her loan will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. Flora looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, she dreams that her business will continue to grow. Flora wants her children to finish their studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week, as it helps her to be stronger and closer to God with all the Bible studies being conducted. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a factory worker, and a mother to her three children, all of whom are still in school. She, together with her husband, manages their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Flora is an accessory maker. She buys materials like strings and different kinds of beads for making accessories like bracelets and necklaces for men and women. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials for the accessories. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Flora dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beads and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 23 year old from Gaza.  He has owned a minimarket since 2010, and he asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy display refrigerators, shelves and an electricity generator.

Ihab hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy display refrigerators, shelves and an electricity generator.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El progreso es un grupo de tres personas que desean emprender y mejorar su calidad de vida. De este grupo la presidenta es Rosalía ya que es una persona trabajadora, luchadora y muy responsable. Rosalía vive con sus dos hijos en Latacunga.

Rosalía junto con sus hijos se dedican a la crianza de animales como cerdos y pollos, negocio que ha ido creciendo con el esfuerzo de todos, Rosalía tiene deseos de emprender y que su negocio crezca, es por eso que realiza un crédito en Fodemi el mismo que será invertido en la compra de 10 crías de  cerdos rosados, compra de balanceado y para la compra de 100 pollos, inversión que les permitirá obtener buenos ingresos e incrementaras sus clientes.

Rosalía sueña en tener un galpón grande pollos y tener muchos cerdos para poder distribuir a empresas grandes.
texts.en:
El Progreso is a group of three people who want to set about improving their quality of life. The group president is Rosalía who is a hardworking person, a fighter who is very trustworthy. Rosalía lives with her two children in Latacunga.

Rosalía and her children are in the work of raising animals like pigs and chickens, a business that has grown through the efforts of all of them. Rosalía has the desire to begin expanding her business. This is why she is getting a loan through Fodemi to be invested in the purchase of ten pink piglets, purchase of feed and for the purchase of 100 chickens. The loan will permit her to obtain good income and increase her customer base.

Rosalía dreams of having a big chicken barn and of having many pigs in order to distribute to large companies.

loans.use: to buy 10 pink piglets, animal feed, and 100 chickens for her business.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 40 years old. Juanito is married and has one child. To make a living, Juanito makes and sells snack foods. He has been in this business for three years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Juanito joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to buy meats, hot dogs and other snack items to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy meats, hot dogs and other snack items to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 68 years old and lives with her family in San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has run an eatery (or carenderia) for more than 25 years now. She sells food and beverages to the people in the community.

Editha is asking for a loan to buy cooking materials for her eatery such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, cooking oil, and beverages.
She dreams of making her business a success in the future so that she can provide a good life to her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking materials for her eatery such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, cooking oil, and beverages

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 50 year old married woman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fish vending business for several years now, since her husband is a fisherman.  Florencia is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

In the future, Florencia dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap selling business

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Con 40 años de edad, Zenobia es madre soltera de sus 4 hijos, habita actualmente en una casa propia de material noble. La señora Zenobia es una madre cuya habilidad para el comercio ha ido incrementándose de acuerdo a los años de experiencia que tiene como vendedora de carnes, en un mercado dentro de su localidad. Tiene 15 años trabajnado en el rubro y es muy querida en su entorno laboral, comenta asimismo que todo su esfuerzo y dedicación lo ha hecho por sus hijos. No obstante, tiene que lidiar con los comercializadores de reses que no ofrecen la calidad que ella paga por estos mismos, con bastante criterio y astucia logra conseguir las mejores reses para su negocio y así poder recuperar su inversión, a la vez tiene muchos deseos de poder equipar a futuro su negocio con nuevas balanzas y cortadoras electrónicas. Este es su préstamo numero 13 y muy entusiasmada comenta que la responsabilidad es su afición y promete mantener su buen record como beneficiaria dentro de banco comunal.
Con los  3,000  de MFP necesita para pagar a sus proveedores de reses por adelantado y así aumentar su competividad con  buena calidad para su negocio.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, Zenobia is a single mother of 4 children. She lives in a a brick house she owns. Zenobia is a mother who ability for business has grown with the years of experience she has selling meat in a market in her town. She has been working in this for 15 years and is well liked in her work environment. She remarks that that all of her hard work and effort have been for her children. Nonetheless, she has to deal with beef suppliers who don't the quality of meat she pays for. With a lot of judgement and shrewdness she has been able to get the best beef for her business and recover the investment. She also wants to equip her business in the future with new scales and electronic slicers. This is her 13th loan and she is very enthusiastic. She says that she is responsible with her job and promises to maintain her good record as a beneficiary of her communal bank.

With the 3,000  from MFP, she needs to pay her beef suppliers in advance and thus maintain her competitiveness with good quality in her business.

loans.use: to pay her beef suppliers.

loans.name: Safeena's Group

texts.en:
Safina is a 42-year-old independent woman living in Pakistan with her husband, two daughters, and three sons. Her eldest son is doing a private job while rest of her children are studying in the school. Her husband is a taxi driver while Safina is a very hard-working tailor. Since 2010 she has been operating her business very efficiently. They live in a rented house and sometimes she doesn't have enough money to pay the rent.

As a member of 10 person lending group, Safina has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new tailoring machine for the growth of her business. With the profit she will open a tailoring shop as currently she is doing all work at home. She will also purchase more items like clothes and tailoring accessories in the future. She wants to give her children a good education so that they can have a better life. Safina dreams to open her new tailoring shop asap so that she can increase her sales and income. Lots of prayers and many thanks for all staff of BRAC and KIVA from her. 

Note: In the picture Safina holds her pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
LUIS ALBERTO tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la hija y con la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

LUIS ALBERTO se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que tanta falta le hace. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es comprar un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 23 years old, is cohabitating, and has a daughter. He lives with his daughter and wife in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. He is part of Ventanilla 5 de Septiembre, located in the area Los Plátanos. He belongs to Cantón Ventanas, and they are engaged to agricultural and livestock jobs. 

Luis Alberto is engaged to agriculture and livestock. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid for weed. With the help of credit, he will buy what he really needs. He will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy a car. The challenges he faces are the diseases. In his spare time he enjoys playing sports and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid for weed.

loans.name: Berta Melania

texts.es: Bertha Melania de  45 años de edad,  casada con tres hijos de 30, 26,14 anos de los cuales la hija  menor esta bajo su responsabilidad. Bertha corresponde al departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Bertha tiene por actividad económica un taller de la elaboración de tortillas, venta de frijoles cosidos,  venta de refrescos. Ubicado en su casa de habitación, actividad que la desempeña  desde hace 8 años. El negocio lo inicio con algunos ahorros propio y ayuda del esposo quien siempre la ha apoyado, hoy en día es un negocio estable el cual me ha ayudado para sacar adelantes a sus hijos. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima  como maíz, leña, frijoles. Bertha ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 el cual ha demostrado ser responsable de pago en tiempo y forma. La rutina diaria de Bertha es levantarse a la 4 am a nisquesar el maíz y posteriormente elaborar las tortillas, las cuales vende en su casa a clientes fijos y eventuales. Bertha Melania agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Bertha Melania is 45  years old. She is married and has three children, aged 30, 26, and 14. Her youngest daughter is under her responsibility. Bertha is from the department of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. Bertha's economic activity is a shop where she makes tortillas and sells cooked beans and beverages. The shop is located in her house and she has done this activity for 8 years. She started the business with some of her own savings and with her husband's help. He has always supported her. Today it is a stable business which has helped her get her children ahead. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and buy raw materials such as corn, firewood and beans. Bertha has already worked with the Fundación León 2000 and has shown herself to be responsible by making her payments on time. Bertha's daily routine is getting up at 4 a.m. to grind the corn and later make the tortillas. She sells them from her home to regular and non-regular customers. Bertha Melania in thankful for the help offered by the Kiva investors to low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so they can have income and dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to make tortillas, such as corn, firewood and beans.

loans.name: Evaristo Reinaldo

texts.es:
EVARISTO REINALDO tiene 53 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

EVARISTO REINALDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Las compras las realizará en Quinsaloma.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es comprar hectáreas de terreno para sembrar maíz. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y las enfermedadaes por el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Evaristo Reinaldo is 53 years old and in a common-law marriage. He has three children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. 
He is a member of the 5th of September communal bank, located in the banana precinct, which is part of the Ventanas canton, where people work in agriculture and livestock.
Evaristo Reinaldo works in agriculture, cultivating corn and rice. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer. He will make the purchases in Quinsaloma.
With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what is necessary for cultivation. His dream is to buy hectares of land to cultivate corn. The challenges that he faces are pests and sickness due to the bad climate. In his free time, he likes to do domestic chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Dominga Antonia

texts.es: Doña Dominga microempresaria de éxito que lleva varios prestamos con la institución trabaja con crédito grupales, ella vende frutas frescas de variedad ambulantes en las calles de Masaya. Como cumplidora en sus pagos sus socias del grupo son beneficiadas con un préstamo de Auto estima que consiste en invertir en ellas mismas como embellecimiento corporal, salud en realizarse exámenes, compra de medicamentos, compra de  aparato eléctrico etc. estos préstamos se le dan a nuestros clientes fieles, cumplidores en sus pagos y con los consentimientos de las demás socias. El caso particular de Dominga quiere sufragar gastos médicos como hacerse unos exámenes de control,  compra de medicamentos para columna vertebral etc.
texts.en: Dominga is a succesful micr-businesswoman and she has had several loans with the institution with group loans. She sells fresh fruit in the streets of Masaya. Since they make their payments responsibly, the members of the group are benefitting from a self-esteem loan that is to invest in themselves by paying for beauty treatments, medications, appliances, etc. These loans are given to faithful clients who make all their payments and with the consent of the other members. In the case of Dominga, she wants to pay some medical expenses such as tests, and medications for her spine, etc.

loans.use: eto invest in medical expenses such as tests and medication for her spine, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina de 45 años, esta casada con Victoriano de 51 años, son una pareja muy empeñosa, tienen 4 hijos y juntos logran conformar una linda familia, habitando actualmente en una casa propia a base de material noble que lograron concretar con mucho Esfuerzo y trabajo. Desde hace 20 años aproximadamente, Alejandrina se levanta muy temprano para abrir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes acoplada en el interior de su domicilio y con mucho esmero recibe a sus distinguidos clientes y que siempre ella procura darle una buena atención y eso le valió para ganarse un lugar en el aprecio de sus vecinos. No obstante debe llevar una sana competencia con dos nuevos locales similares que aperturaron sus puertas y eso le dio la iniciativa de surtir aún con más variedad su negocio y poder a la vez tener un crecimiento para el beneficio de su familia. Este es su crédito número 12 y se compromete en pagar con puntualidad. Muy contenta comenta que le es de mucho agrado el trabajo en su banco comunal porque afortunadamente los integrantes son muy motivadores y eso le vale a ella para seguir avanzando como persona. Con su préstamo de 2,000 soles procederá a realizar la compra de víveres al por mayor para poder surtir aún más su negocio, lo cual incluye más sacos de arroz, azúcar, cereales procesados  y embasados, entre otros.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 45 years old and is married to Victoriano who is 51 years old. They are a very hard-working couple, they have four children and together managed to form a beautiful family. They are currently living in a house they own made with durable material, achieved with much effort and work. From 20 years ago approximately, Alejandrina gets up very early to open her small grocery store attached inside her home. She welcomes her distinguished customers with care, and she always tries to provide a good service. That allowed her to gain the appreciation of her neighbors. 

However, she needs to lead a healthy competition with two similar new stores which opened their doors recently. That gave her the initiative to stock her business with more variety and, at the same time, expand it for the benefit of her family.

This is the credit number 12 and she agrees on paying on time. Very happy, she says she likes the work in her communal bank because fortunately, the members are very motivating and that helped her to keep growing as a person. With her loan of 2,000 soles she will proceed to buy food in bulk to stock better her business, which includes sacks of rice, sugar, processed and packed cereals, and others.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, processed and packed cereals.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly tiene 27 años, vive conjuntamente con Mauro de 33 años y apuesta su trabajo y esfuerzo por su pequeño Nuel de 7 años. Anmbos lograron un sólido hogar, en el que tiene una casa propia a bas de madera. Muy hacendosa, ella impulsó a su esposo abrir un negocio propio en su domicilio y vieron conveniente una tienda de abarrotes, puers era la mejor opción debido a la ausencia de estos en su barrio, logrando consolidar el negocio desde hace 10 años. Ella aplica todas sus ganas de trabajar y lo que la motiva más es que puede estar siempre en compañía de su pequeño hijo. Afortunadamente estos últimos años  el negocio a tenido mas acogida que en los años anteriores, casualmente su proveedor le ha ofrecido ofertas especiales con la condición de que las compras se realicen en mayor cantidad y ella con el fin de poder incrementar sus ganancias ha decidido no perder esta ocasión, gracias a ello su negocio muestra una mejoría considerable. A futo desea ampliar su negocio como siempre soñó. Este es su crédito numero 3 por tanto es un muy buen comienzo para ella, siempre atenta con sus compañeros, incluso toma nota de los acuerdos. Con los 2,000 logrará aprovechar la oferta de productos que le ofrece su proveedor como fideos,leche, conservas y cereales y así tener mejores ganancias para su negocio,
texts.en:
Magaly, 27, lives with Mauro, 33, and she commits all of her work and efforts to her small child Nuel, who is 7.  She and her partner have managed to obtain a solidly built home made of wood.  Very industrious, she urged her husband to open a business in their home, seeing that a grocery store might be a good idea.  This was the best option, since the neighborhood was lacking this kind of store.  They've managed to consolidate this business over the last 10 years.

Magaly puts into practice all of her desire to work, and what motivates her the most is that she is able to always be with her small child.  Fortunately, in recent years her business has gained acceptance compared to prior years, and as it happens, her supplier has given her special offers under the condition that she makes her purchases in larger quantities.  Magaly, with the goal of increasing her earnings, has decided not to pass up this opportunity, because thanks to this her business will see a considerable improvement.  In the future, she wants to expand her business as she has always dreamed of doing.  

This is Magaly's third loan, and so this is a very good beginning for her.  She is always attentive to her fellow group members, and is always aware of the agreements made by the group.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will take advantage of the sale that her supplier is offering on products such as: noodles, milk, preserves, and cereals.  This way she will increase her earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, preserves and cereals

loans.name: Kenan

texts.en:
Kenan is 25-years-old, married and has two children. His oldest child is five and the youngest is three years old. He lives in the Roma community in Kosovo. 

Kenan works as a taxi driver. He has been in business for five years and his business and client base are growing steadily. He has developed a good reputation in the community. Recently his vehicle broke down and Kenan was unable to work and generate income for his family. He is requesting a loan to pay for the repair costs and new tires. This loan will help him to be able to continue with his business and hopefully expand into new lines of transportation in Kosovo. He is planning to continue to work hard to improve and expand his business. 

Kenan thanks all Kiva lenders for this opportunity!

loans.use: to pay for repair costs and new tires

loans.name: Celia Lorena

texts.es:
CELIA LORENA tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

CELIA LORENA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea un cerdo y polbillo. Las compras las realizará en Mocache.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y comprar un animal para criarlo y venderlo. El sueño es arreglar la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Celia Lorena is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her children and husband in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. She is a member of the Ventanilla 5 de Septiembre group which is located in the banana region, belonging to the canton of Ventanas where they work in agriculture and livestock.

Celia Lorena works in agriculture growing corn and raising pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, a pig, and polvillo [dust or powder sometimes made from rice which can be an ingredient in animal feed]. The purchases are made in Mocache.

With the help of the loan she can buy what is needed for the crops and buy an animal to raise and sell. Her dream is to fix up the house. The challenges that she faces are pests. In her free time she likes to do housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, polvillo, and a pig to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Jhona is 24 years old, single and lives in Calamba. Her family helps her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for two years and earn 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jhona joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding.

loans.name: Vert

texts.en:
Vert is a 58-year-old married mother who lives with her husband and three children, residing in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Out of her three children, Vert still has two children to take care of and they are still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice on a 1.5-hectare area of farmland. 

Vert has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. She fully paid back the loan. Vert has smartly and successfully utilized the previous loan to support the family with sufficient foods. Now she is requesting a new loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR. She is going to use a portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline for water pumping. With this loan, Vert hopes to improve her standard of living as well as to increase her income from the current business and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 37 years old, married and has two children. He does welding to earn a living. He makes doors, window frames and gates. He has been in the business for six years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business; hence, increasing his income levels. His training in business management skills is thanks to Faulu Kenya.

David hopes to open another outlet for his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: Lesbia  María de  60 anos de edad, madre soltera con un hijo mayor de edad. Lesbia corresponde al municipio de Nagarote, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente, Nagarote de ha caracterizado por ser una de las ciudades mas limpia del país, y trabajos de artesanías.  Lesbia tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación y tiene 32 anos de tener el negocio. Una pulpería es un tienda donde se venden productos comestible de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como bolsitas de café, bolsitas de champo, una caja de fosforo, arroz x libra, ¼ de aceite, jugos, gaseosas, frescos naturales. Lesbia ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000  y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeña pulpería para obtener mejores ingresos y poder abastecer a sus clientes con productos que ellos solicitan. Lesbia agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Lesbia Maria, 60, is single and is the mother of a grown son.  She lives in the municipality of Nagarote, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  Nagarote is known for being one of the cleanest cities in the country, and it is also known for its handicrafts.  Lesbia has had a convenience store  located in her house for 32 years.  This is the kind of store where consumer staples are sold in small quantities, for example, small bags of coffee and shampoo, a box of matches, rice by the pound, small containers of cooking oil, juices, soft drinks, and fresh drinks.  Lesbia has already worked with the Fundacion Leon 2000, and has demonstrated responsibility in making her payments on time and in full.  

Lesbia needs a loan to invest in working capital to stock her small grocery store.  This way, she will obtain more income and be able to have the products in stock that her customers are looking for.  Lesbia appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent standard of living.

loans.use: to stock up her general store

loans.name: Jenny Janeth

texts.es:
JENNY JANETH tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con la pareja en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

ES integrante de la Ventanilla 16 de Agosto, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Agua Fría de Mocache, Pertenece al Cantón Mocache se dedican a labores agricolas y Pecuarias.

JENNY JANETH se dedica a la agricultura, además cría animales cómo pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para engordarlos y venderlos aún buen precio.

El sueño es comprar un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la peste que cae a los animales. En elt iempo libre le gusta ver televisión, alimentar a los animales y realizar los Quehaceres Domésticos.
texts.en:
Jenny Janeth is 41 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children. She lives with her partner and her children in the city of Ventanas in the province of De Los Rios. She is a member of the "16th of Agosto" communal bank, located in The Agua Ria de Mocache area of Mocache canton. People there make their living from agriculture and livestock-raising.

Jenny Janet is a farmer and also raises animals such as chickens and pigs. She's applying for the loan in order to buy chickens and pigs. 

With the help of the loan she will be able to buy animals in order to fatten and sell them at an even better price. Her dream is to buy a car. The challenges she faces are diseases that affect the animals. 

In her free time she likes to watch television, feed the animals, and do her household tasks.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Michael Uriel

texts.es: Michael Uriel de  29 años de edad, casada del departamento de Chinandega con dos hijos de  5,2 años. Originario del  municipio de Villa nueva  donde su mayor actividad económica es comercialización de ganado, el tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado, desde hace 8 años que desempeña dicha actividad. El negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante. Michael es una persona responsable, el ya ha trabajado con fundación en créditos anteriores lo cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad con los pagos. La rutina de Michael Uriel es salir a las comarcas aledañas a comprar ganado en pie para su posterior venta a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. El está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y de dicha forma poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos. Michael agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Michael Uriel, 29, is married and lives in the department of Chinandega with his 2 children: aged 5 and 2.  He is a native of the municipality of Villa Nueva, where his main economic activity is selling cattle.  He has been buying and selling cattle for 8 years.  He makes his sales from place to place. Michael is a responsible person who has already worked with the Fundacion, taking previous loans where he demonstrated responsibility with his payments.  

Michael Uriel's routine is to go out to the outlying regions to buy live cattle to later sell to his regular customers and to others.  He is requesting a loan to invest in working capital so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers and obtain better earnings.  Michael appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent standard of living.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Juan Fermin

texts.es:
El señor Juan Fermin es casado, tiene 51 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo juntamente con sus hermanos y hasta ahora lleva 26 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Juan Fermín, aged 51, is married and the father of six children, with three of them studying. He himself attended elementary school until third grade. He is a knitter. He started this activity with his siblings and has so far gained a 26-year-long experience. Juan Fermín applies for a loan to buy thread of various kinds and colors. He hopes that his business will have a bright future with better profits.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Crisente

texts.en:
Crisente lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. He has been providing transportation services for four years so as to meet the needs of his three children. He makes an income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from this business. For a 42-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than seeing his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Crisente borrowed 3,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories and provide his children with a better education. He is new in GDMPC. His plan for the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Marjorie Agglaer

texts.es: Marjorie tiene 33 años de edad estado civil soltera tiene 2 hijos menores de edad . Ella cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de desempleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien ,la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que tiene .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar .perfume ,cremas,colonias,desodorantes,talcos
texts.en: Marjorie is 33 years old. She is single and has two young children. She tells us that she started selling cosmetics because of the high unemployment rates in her country, as she wanted to find work but had to resort to self-employment instead. Her cosmetics business is going well. She works in the afternoon, selling the products she has to the neighbours. With the loan, she wants to buy the following: perfume, creams, cologne, deodorant, and talcum powder.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 53 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two grown children. She manages a retail store where she sells any kind of food products. She has had this store for five years and earns a total of about 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to obtain more food items to sell. In the future, Esther hopes for business expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more food items to sell

loans.name: Wilber Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilber es un microempresario que se dedica a comprar y vender plátanos, melón, sandias al por mayor y al detalle en el mercado de su  localidad, inicio su negocio desde hace 12 años vendiendo sandias en pedazos, y melón en unidades menores, con esfuerzos y solicitando prestamos ha venido creciendo que en la actualidad comercializa platanos, sandias y melon al por mayor y al detalle. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de plátanos, sandias, melón.
texts.en:
Wilber has a small business buying and selling plantains, cantaloupes, and watermelons at wholesale and retail in the local market. He started his business 12 years ago, selling pieces of watermelon, as well as cantaloupe in small quantities.

With hard work and by requesting loans he has gradually expanded, and now sells plantains, watermelons and cantaloupes at wholesale and retail. He will invest the loan in the purchase of plantains, watermelons and cantaloupes.

loans.use: To buy plantains, watermelons and cantaloupes at wholesale.
