loans.name: Marco

texts.es: El Sr. Marco tiene 30 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  4  y 8 años, el se dedica a la venta de variedad de juguetes en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de Alcoche,  este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Marco va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para levantar muralla de terreno su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que ya quiere hacer construir en su terreno, el Sr. Marco enfrenta retos en su negocio que son generar mejores ingresos y tener una casita propia y brindar mayor comodidad a su familia y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marco, 30, is married and has two children, ages four and eight. He works selling a variety of toys in his store, which is located in Alcoche. This is his first loan from the institution. Marco will use the loan to buy construction materials to build an earth wall. His reason for applying for the loan is that he wants to build on his land. Marco confronts many challenges in his business, which are earning a greater income, having his own house, and giving his family greater comfort and in the end, improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to build an earth wall.

loans.name: Juana Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Juana Micaela es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos, ninguno estudian,  se dedica a la venta de papas fritas y a la atención a aun molino de mixtamal, lleva 5 años de experiencia vendiendo papa y teniendo el molino, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la sastrería.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara apara la compra de papas por quintal y así mejoras sus ventas, en el futuro espera ver un negocios grande, y mejora la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Micaela is 51 and married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has three children; none go to school. She sells fried potatoes and operates a mill for grinding corn.

She has five years experience selling potatoes and having her mill. She has the help of her husband, who is a tailor. 

She is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase potatoes by the quintal (100 lb), and this way improve her sales. In the future she hopes to see her business grow, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potatoes by the quintal.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 30-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession, but currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi as its engine is not working properly. He wants to repair it as soon as possible as they are facing many financial problems. 

For this reason, Yasmeen, a member of a nine person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the profit, she will be looking to purchase a sewing machine so that she can generate some money and help her husband financially by sewing clothes. Yasmeen wants to provide a quality education for all her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC.

Note: In the picture, Yasmeen is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi engine.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, desde hace 8 años. Se desempeña en su rubro de lunes a domingo de 9ºº a 22ºº horas, tiene su bazar ubicado en un espacio que adapto en su casa. Se dedica a vender productos lácteos, mercadería en general.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará cigarros, bebidas y mercadería como detergente, arroz, azúcar, te.
Una de las metas de Yeny es tener una verdulería dentro de su bazar, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Yeny vive junto a sus padres, marido y dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral seguir creciendo y abastecerse de mas mercadería, y a nivel familiar darle una buena educación a sus hijas para que lleguen a la universidad.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al  grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que es muy responsable y unido.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Yeny belongs to the communal bank “El Milagro” in the city of Curicó. For the past 8 years on Mondays to Sundays from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m., she has been selling general merchandise and milk products from a space in her house. She must purchase the merchandise from supermarkets and dealers where she finds low prices that make her business economically feasible. She will use the loan to buy cigarettes, beverages, detergent, rice, sugar, and tea.

One of Yeny's goals is to sell fruits and vegetables from her shop, thereby generating more income and a higher standard of living. Yeny lives with her parents, husband, and two children ages 12 and 6. Regarding her business, her dream is to keep growing and stocking more merchandise. Her dream for her family is to provide her children with a good education so that they will go to college.

Yeny is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will let her invest in her business. She says the training has been fundamental to her business and personal development, and she has learned how to better manage her income and investments. She says that her communal bank members are responsible and united.

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the center of the country. Curicó's Mediterranean-style climate is one of the nicest in the country. The city is known for its wine making and beautiful surroundings. Despite the fact that the labor force has increased, according to the latest census, the area continues to be one of the country's poorest.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cigarettes, beverages, detergent, rice, sugar, and tea.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de joyas y ropa, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa y otras veces s ella quien sale a ofrecer su mercadería a su clientela de casa en casa, se desempaña de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras e importadoras donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará joyas, pantalones, calzas, ropa interior para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Silvia es seguir en su rubro, crecer cada dia y tener un negocio bien abastecido para atender a su clientela y quede satisfecha con la compra.
Silvia vive junto a su esposo, un hijo de 27 años de edad y dos nietos de 20 y 11 años de edad, que se encuentran al cuidado de ella. Sus sueños a nivel laboral mantener su negocio y su clientela, y a nivel personal tener buena salud para seguir generando ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de  la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo dl Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en: Silvia belongs to El Milagro ('the miracle') communal bank, in the city of Curicó. She has been selling jewellery and clothes for the last two years. She says that she works at her home, but that she sometimes goes out to pander her wares from door to door. She works Mondays to Sundays and her working hours vary according to her availability. She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, from various distributors and importers that sell at a low price, which is advantageous for her. WIth this loan, Silvia will buy jewellery, trousers, tights, and underwear to sell. One of Silvia's goals is to remain in business, to grow each day and have enough stock to keep her customers happy and satisfied with their purchase. She lives with her husband, her 27-year-old son and two grandsons, who are 20 and 11 years old and whom she provides for. Silvia's professional dreams are to keep her business and her customers. Her personal dreams are to stay healthy so as to keep making money and improve her family's quality of life. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity afforded to her by field partner Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the communal bank she belongs to has great communication between the members. Furthermore, the training dispensed there was very useful to her, as she was able to learn new sale strategies as well as accounting techniques. Curicó is located in the Maule region, at the heart of the country. The city boasts a Mediterranean climate, considered one of the balmiest in the country. Its main cultural attraction is wine; its main natural one, the wonderful surroundings. Despite the recent increase in the workforce, the region still is, according to the last census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Aracelly

texts.es:
CARMEN ARACELLY tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

CARMEN ARACELLY  se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, polbillo. Las compras lo hace en Quinsaloma.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa, Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades n en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gustahacer los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Carmen Aracelly, 37, is in a common-law marriage and has two children. She lives with her husband and two children in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. 

She is a member of the September 5th solidarity group. This is located in the Los Plátanos precinct. It belongs to the Ventanas canton. The people there work in farming and fishing.

Carmen Aracelly works raising animals. She is applying for the loan to buy pigs and feed. She makes these purchases in Quinsaloma.

Her dream is to buy land to build a house. The challenges she faces are diseases in the herds. In her free time, she likes to do domestic chores.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 30 years old, married to Rosebella, and blessed with four children aged eight, six, four and one year respectively. He repairs shoes, a business he started five years ago which earns him a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

Ernest has requested his second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase shoe soles, laces, shoe polish, brushes and other materials required in his business. He will reinvest the anticipated profit into his enterprise as he works toward his dream of being a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase shoe soles, laces, shoe polish, brushes and other materials required in his business.

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She and her spouse generate income by providing transport services to the people in their village. While her husband provides the services, she does household chores and takes care of their children.

Narissa is now requesting a loan of P25,000 to further improve the services offered by her husband. She will buy tires, gasoline and crude oil for the business, and promises to pay back her loan in full.

Someday, with sufficient earnings, Narissa will start up a small store to add to their income.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline and crude oil for use in the transport business.

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en:
Man, 42, is married with seven children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Out of her seven children, she still has five children to take care of. Some are still in school and some help the family’s business. To make a living, she has been engaging in farming rice for several years and selling fish while her husband supplements the income by catching fish. She is able to earn about 30,000KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.  

Man’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and fully paid back the loans which have helped her constantly support her family with enough foods and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Man will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on purchasing materials for her husband’s fish catching business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to better her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Marlene Concepcion

texts.es: Marlene tiene 49 años estado civil soltera de edad tiene 1 hijo Ella vende cosméticos es un muy buen ingreso para ella .ese ha sido su medio de sustento, pues le va bien en su negocio. su sueño es incrementar mas su negocio poner más variedad a sus productos. Su horario de trabajo es en las tardes cuando les ofrece el producto  a sus vecinos. Su sueño es lograr una gran empresa de cosméticos y poder dar trabajos a muchas mujeres solteras Con el préstamo ella va a comprar todo lo que es cosmético como: perfumes, cremas, colonias etc.
texts.en: Marlene is 49 years old. She is single and has one son. She sells cosmetics, and her business provides her with a nice income, thus enabling her to support herself. Her dream is to keep her business growing and to offer a greater variety of products. She works in the afternoon selling her products to neighbours. Her dream is to found a big cosmetics retail business and to be able to give work to many single women. With the loan, she will be buying cosmetics to sell: perfume, cream, cologne, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo started to dream with simple things in life, he first ventured into the farming business by cultivating a corn field. He is thankful because his business improvement grew from his patience and resourcefulness.

Herminigildo's commitment to his farming business brought him to the realization of needing to adopt new farming strategies to be able to achieve continuous improvement. He currently raises one sow and three fattening pigs. Herminigildo's wife is a business-minded person who wants to succeed in life.

Herminigildo has paid back his previous loan and has asked for a larger loan amount of PHP30,000. This amount will be use to buy hog feed and necessary vitamins for continuous good nutrition and proper growth of his hogs. He hopes to make his business more profitable so that he can let his youngest child finish his coursework and improve their financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and necessary vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
This is Guadalupe. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Guadalupe hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 34-year-old married mother of two children, the oldest five years old. In the business of hog-raising for two years, Rosalina plans to use her loan to buy additional pigs and feeds. As well, part of the loan will be used to purchase fuel for the motorcycle used by her husband in his habal-habal passenger transport service.

In the future, Rosalina would like to improve her hog-raising business in order to attain greater success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds as well as fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Malvina

texts.es:
Malvina forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de mermeladas en conserva, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que a veces se dedica  a vender ropa cuando la temporada de frutas es escasa y no realiza sus mermeladas, trabaja desde su casa y su horario y días de trabajo es de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras y supermercados con la ayuda de su hija, que se encuentra viviendo en la ciudad, busca la mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará frascos, fogón, tapas de frascos y una olla para hacer las mermeladas.
Una de las metas de Malvina es surgir con su negocio, tener la posibilidad de tener un local especial para la venta de mermeladas, para ayudar con los gastos de su casa y estudios de sus hijas, así optar a una mejor calidad de vida familiar.
Malvina vive junto a su marido y su hija de 16 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando y la mayor se encuentra estudiando en la ciudad de Santiago. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es seguir trabajando para pagar los estudios de sus hijas, y a nivel personal tener un local de diferente rubro que genere más ingresos para la familia.
Ella está muy contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e interese, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Malvina belongs to the communal bank “El Milagro” in the city of Curicó. For the past four years, she has been selling jams. She says she sometimes sells clothing when fruit is not in season and she can't make her jams. She works from her house on a flexible schedule. With the help of her daughter, she purchases the merchandise from supermarkets and dealers in Santiago where she finds low prices that make her business economically feasible. She will use the loan to buy jars, a stove, jar covers, and a pot to make jams. 

One of Malvina's goals is to grow her business and have a separate place to sell jams so that she can help with the household expenses and her daughters' education and her family can enjoy a higher standard of living. Malvina lives with her husband and 16-year-old daughter, who is a student. Her oldest daughter is a student in Santiago. Regarding her business, her dream is to keep working and paying for her children's education. On a personal level, she would like to find work that would generate more income for her family.

Malvina is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will let her invest in her business. She is very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs who belong to her communal bank because they have different jobs and interests that provide a distraction. 

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the center of the country. Curicó's Mediterranean-style climate is one of the nicest in the country. The city is known for its wine making and beautiful surroundings. Despite the fact that the labor force has increased, according to the latest census, the area continues to be one of the country's poorest.

loans.use: to buy jars, a stove, jar covers, and a pot to make jams.

loans.name: Tomasa Ines

texts.es: Tomasa de estado civil casada tiene 1 hija .  Ella vio a la venta de cosméticos como un buen ingreso para ella por eso se puso a vender cosméticos y le resulta muy bien  Su ingreso económico es con la venta de productos cosméticos ese ha sido su medio de sustento, pues le va bien en su negocio su sueño es incrementar mas su negocio poner más variedad a sus productos. Su horario de trabajo es en las tardes cuando les ofrece el producto  a sus vecinos. Su sueño es lograr una gran empresa de cosméticos y poder dar trabajos a muchas mujeres solteras Con el préstamo ella va a comprar todo lo que es cosmético como: perfumes, cremas, colonias etc.
texts.en: Tomasa is married and has one son. She saw cosmetics sales as a good source of income and decided to make it her business. It is now going well: she is able to support herself. Her dream is to make her business grow even more and to offer a greater variety of products. She works in the afternoon selling her products to neighbours. Her dream is to found a great cosmetics retail business and to give work to many single women. With the loan, Tomasa will buy cosmetics to sell: perfume, cream, cologne, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is from the Sagarejo district in the Kakheti region. She is 56 years old and lives with her 27-year-old daughter. The family runs a poultry farm and has been in this business for 10 years. They raise chicks and sell the adult hens in the capital city. Tamar is hard working woman who is responsible and very well known in the area for her big heart and friendliness with others.

Tamar has requested a loan to purchase additional chicks and expand her poultry farm. The other part of the loan will be used for chicken feed. Tamar will raise chickens and then sell the hens at a good price. She considers her business to be profitable since it generates a good income that enables her to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28, single and living with four family members, one of whom is employed.

Housam owns a shop selling stationary and mobile accessories. He established his business in 2010 and now he has an employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1800 youth loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
This is Dante, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. His wife is Dorotea, the mother of his two children. Together with his wife, Dante manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dante operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. Dante hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving his family a good life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Señor De Ccoyllority De Huayllabamba Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority de Huayllabamba” en la ciudad  de Huayllabamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería. El socio Aquilino nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 8 hijos. Su actividad económica del  socio Aquilino es la agricultura, el socio se dedica a sembrar diferentes tipos de hortalizas y tubérculos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Aquilino desea comprar fertilizante y semillas. (El socio Aquilino esta levantando la mano en la fotografía).  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the "Señor de Ccoyllority de Huayllabamba" communal bank in the city of Huayllabamba in the province of  Urubamba, in Cusco department. This communal bank is made up of people who are continually looking for opportunities to succeed, and with their daily effort, to provide a better future for their children. 

The majority of the members work in agriculture and raise livestock.  The borrower, Aquilino, was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and lives in the same city where he was born. He is 66 years old, married, and has eight children. 

Aquilino's livelihood is farming, and he grows various types of vegetables and tubers. He has been farming for several years now, and it is going extremely well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. 

On this occasion, Aquilino wishes to buy fertilizer and seeds. Aquilino is seen in the photo, raising his hand.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity offered, and promise to make their various installment payments on time.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in Cusco department. It is in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas, and is known for being a tourist area, for its archaeological sites, for its historical center, for its scenery, for its history, and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. 

Cusco is known for being a major tourist and commercial area, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu, is located there.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, 36, is married and from the city of Mombasa. She’s blessed with four children. Mwanakombo is very hard-working and has her own retail shop. Her business started out with a little capital which, added to the good customer service she provides, has resulted in its growth.

She requests a loan to buy supplies for her business at wholesale to meet customer demand, increase sales and as a result, her income. She wants to buy sugar, wheat flour,maize flour, cooking oil, etc. She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because it will be of great help to allow her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gissela Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 20 años de edad estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos .Vio la necesidad de buscar un empleo pero como nadie se lo daba el trato de salir de esa crisis económica que vivía, Ella  comenzó de a poquita mercadería  de ropa ahora el vende mucha mercadería y su sueño es  brindarle trabajo a personas que no tenga. Ella trabaja de 8:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, ropa para bebe etc.
texts.en: Karina is 20, single, and has no children. She needed to find work to overcome her poor economic situation, but no one offered her a way to do so. So she began selling a little merchandise, and now she sells a lot. Her dreams of employing other people without jobs. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She will use the loan to buy pants, skirts, blouses, clothing for infants, and so forth.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, blouses, clothing for infants, and so forth.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28, married and with two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Haidar owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008 and now has an employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2700 as a youth loan to pay the annual rent and increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and increase inventory.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is from Sagarejo district, East Georgia. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband, three children and her parents. Khatuna’s children go to the local school. Her parents are provided with a retirement pension. Khatuna’s husband works at the Ministry of Defence of Georgia and gets a monthly income. The family runs a small dairy farm of two calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy production. Khatuna sells her dairy products at the local market. Khatuna is very hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to purchase sheep. After the sheep are purchased she will be able to get milk, produce more cheese and sell lambs. This will significantly increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in the family's agricultural business and all members of the family will have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married with six children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been growing rice on three-hectare area of farmland for fourteen years while her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income. The current business earns her family approximately 20,000 KHR per day and allows them to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Phally’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and this is the first loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 600,000 KHR each. Phally is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so she can make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy animals for an animal-selling business.

loans.name: Delgin

texts.en:
Delgin is married with two children. Delgin is 30 years old, and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Delgin owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been in business for eight years. Each month, she earns 4,050 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase pesticides and pay the cost of planting bananas. In the future, Delgin wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and pay the cost of planting bananas.

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu, who runs a grocery mainly selling tomatoes, used her previous loan to add a stock of tomatoes. Her business improved and generated more income. She used the additional income from her business to buy fertilizer for her farm.

Ndanu hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested another loan of 100,000 KES to buy tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married, and has five children, two of who are employed.
 
Mohamad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2006 and now has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install a new ceiling for the shop and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a new ceiling for his shop and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is 33 years old and residing in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married with three sons, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. The main source of family’s income is rice farming on seven hectares of farmland, a business which she and her husband have been engaged in for five years to support the family. Together, they can generate an income of approximately 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business.

Ly’s group is composed of six members who are all the first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. Ly, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline. Ly hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sara Ilma

texts.es:
Sara tiene 30 años, vive al lado de su pequeño hijo a quien quiere muchísimo y por quien  trabaja cada día muy duro para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo para poder hacerlo una persona de bien, Sara saca adelante a su hijo sola ya que el padre de su hijo la abandono cuando todavía era un bebe y desde ese momento Sara se convirtió en padre y madre para él.  Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo dedicación y ahorro Sara logro iniciar su negocio de vena de frutas y abarrotes en su vivienda, ella lleva trabajando en su negocio alrededor de 2 años, en los cuales ha aprendido mucho y sobre todo ha salido adelante poco a poco; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene un buen trat5o hacia sus cliente sy sobre todo porque por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Sara está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como ropa para niños como pantalones, politos buzos, entre otros, así ella podra mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera seguir adelante para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Sara is 30 years old. She lives with her small son, whom she loves very much, and for whom she works hard every day, so that she can give him a decent life. Above all, she wants to see him become a person of worth.

Sara is raising her son on her own, as her child's father abandoned her when her son was still a baby. From that time, Sara became father and mother for him.

With much effort, and especially dedication and saving, Sara managed to start her business selling fruit and groceries from her home. She has been working in her business for around two years, and in that time has learned a great deal. Above all, she has made progress little by little.

She believes her business is going well because of her good customer service, and especially because of her desire to succeed. 

Sara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, such as children's clothing: including pants, T-shirts, track suits and other items. This way she will be able to improve her income and so keep moving forward so that she can realize her great dream: "To give my son a good education."

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as children clothing, including pants, T-shirts track suits, and other items.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is from Sagarejo district. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of several milk cows. Makvala milks the cows every day and produces cheese products which are sold at the capital city supermarkets. In addition, her husband has a truck and takes the wood from the forest.  The wood is sold in their village and nearby villages Makvala is a very hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead.
She requested a loan to purchase food for calves. With this credit, she will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cattle during the fall and winter seasons. Since the calves will be fed properly, Makvala will be able to receive a planned amount of milk and produce cheese products. This will increase the monthly income of the family and they will improve the living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for calves

loans.name: Jiyad

texts.en:
Jiyad is from Iraq. He is 42 years old and married, with three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Jiyad owns a very small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2005, and he now has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,100 to buy a new refrigerator and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang, aged 55, resides in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia, with her husband. She has seven children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She has been growing rice and corn while her husband helps the family to earn additional income by raising pigs and catching fish in the local area. Together, they are able to earn approximately 40,000KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Ang’s group is composed of two members who live in the same village . She is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000KHR and 500,000KHR respectively. As the leader, Ang will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also hopes to make more income so as to improve her family living's condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente s la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa usada y nueva para todo tipos de personas y edades, desde hace 3 años. Se desempeña en su rubro en feria libres trabajando cuatro días de la semana de 9ºº a 16ºº horas y los domingos todo el dia.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en importadoras donde encuentra la ropa por fardos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa para la temporada de verano.
Una de las metas de Sandra es tener un negocio propio donde pueda atender a su clientela de manera más tranquila y mostrar toda su mercadería para una buena venta, y a la vez generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
Sandra vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un local establecido, y a nivel familiar darle un buen pasar a su hijo y un excelente futuro en los estudios.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de  la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Sandra belongs to the communal bank “El Milagro” in the city of Curicó. For the past three years, she has been selling used and new clothing for all ages at open-air markets four days a week from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m and all day on Sundays. She must purchase the merchandise from importers in Santiago where she finds bulk clothing at low prices that make her business economically feasible. She will use the loan to buy bulk clothing for the summer season.
 
One of Sandra's goals is to have her own business where she can offer her clients less hectic service, show her merchandise to better advantage, and generate more income for her family. Sandra lives with her husband and six-year-old son. Regarding her business, her dream is to have an established shop. Her dream for her family is to provide for her son and give him an excellent education. 

Sandra is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will let her invest in her business. She says the communication in her group is very good. The training has helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies. 

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the center of the country. Curicó's Mediterranean-style climate is one of the nicest in the country. The city is known for its wine making and beautiful surroundings. Despite the fact that the labor force has increased, according to the latest census, the area continues to be one of the country's poorest.

loans.use: to buy bulk clothing for the summer season.

loans.name: Teresa Rosario

texts.es: Teresa tiene 54 años de edad estado civil casada, tiene hijos mayores de edad El cuenta que  vendía cola, arroz aceite,  para luego formar una  tienda de víveres en su casa pues eso es lo que ahora es su sustento de vida para Ella y su familia. Su esposo le ayuda con el negocio pues se levantan y luego  a las 7:00am abre su negocio. El anhela que su negocio crezca más y poderlo surtir con mas productos. Pues con el préstamo el comprara mas víveres como .arroz, azúcar,aceite y mejorar su vivienda etc.
texts.en: Teresa is 54 years old. She is married and has adult children. She tells us that she used to sell Coca-Cola, rice, and cooking oil, and that she ended up setting up a grocery shop at her house, which now enables her to support herself and her family. Her husband helps her with the shop: they both wake up in order to open the shop at seven in the morning. Teresa wants to make her shop grow and to offer a greater variety of products. Thus, with the loan, she will buy groceries to sell: rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 46, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pio, a welder, and they have children. They manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Edna is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edna hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Majed owns a car repair shop. He specializes in changing the cars’ oil. He established his business in 2011. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2400 youth loan to install a sunshade for the shop frontage and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a sunshade for the shop frontage and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Raqueza

texts.en:
Raqueza is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Raqueza is married and has three children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns about 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. 

Raqueza is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Felix  Octavio

texts.es: El Sr. Félix  tiene 36 años y es soltero el se dedica a la elaboración de canastas de togoro, este trabajo lo realiza en su domicilio que se encuentran en la zona Mariscal Sucre,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Félix va a usar este préstamo para la compra de togoro este es el material con el que realiza sus canastas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, el Sr. Félix enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta del material para la elaboración de su trabajo por eso con el crédito aprovechara en comprar por mayor y va a utilizar los beneficios para la compra de togoro para stok.
texts.en: Félix is 36 years old and single. He weaves togoro baskets at home. He lives in the Mariscal Sucre region. This loan is his first cycle with the field partner. Félix will use the funds to buy more togoro, which is a kind of wicker he uses to weave his baskets. He needs this loan because he does not have enough capital and thus not enough raw material to work. The loan will enable him to buy wholesale, and he will use the profits to buy more togoro to have in stock.

loans.use: to buy togoro to weave baskets.

loans.name: Alberta's Group

texts.en:
The group is comprised of two women and two men, who three years ago decided to come together to obtain a  loan from ID-Ghana (MFI). This has served them very well, since they have been able to grow their small businesses. They sell provisions or soft drinks, while one of the members is a welder.

Gladys is 58 years and a widow who sells provisions, soft drinks, and cooking utensils. Her children are now adult, taking care of themselves.

Gladys sells to take care of herself and to generate money for her housing project. She has been doing this business for eight years, and things are going on well.

She needs a loan of GHC 850. This loan is for the purchase of two boxes of milk, a box of Milo, a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, and two boxes of soap. She has been with ID-Ghana since 2010. This is her sixth loan.  Her dream is to complete her housing projects in the next two years' time.

The group needs a total of GHC 2,800 to expand business.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of milk, a box of Milo, a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, and two boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de almacén, desde hace 7 meses. Comenta que habilito un espacio de su casa para hacer su negocio, trabaja de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. En su almacén vende productos para la casa, hogar y escolares.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para su almacén la compra en supermercados, distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará vasos, articulos escolares y una máquina para cortar cecinas.
Una de las metas de Maria es agregar venta de completos en su mismo almacén, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su hija, quien le ayuda con las ventas de su almacén. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener una maquina de helados y mas vitrinas para mostrar su mercadería y que su clientela este satisfecha al momento de comprar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
 Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank “El Milagro” in the city of Curicó. For the past seven months, she has been selling stock from a space in her house. She works Mondays to Sundays on a flexible schedule. She sells household goods and school supplies in her shop. She must purchase the merchandise from supermarkets and dealers where she finds low prices that make her business economically feasible. She will use the loan to buy glasses, school supplies, and a machine to cut cured beef.

One of Maria's goals is to sell dish sets in her store so that she can increase her income and enjoy a higher standard of living. Maria lives with her daughter, who helps her in the store. Regarding her business, her dream is to have an ice cream machine and more cases to display merchandise that  satisfies her customers.

Maria is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will let her invest in her business. She also feels comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank because their different jobs and interests provide a distraction. The training provided at meetings has helped her to better manage her business.

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the center of the country. Curicó's Mediterranean-style climate is one of the nicest in the country. The city is known for its wine making and beautiful surroundings. Despite the fact that the labor force has increased, according to the latest census, the area continues to be one of the country's poorest.

loans.use: to buy glasses, school supplies, and a machine to cut cured beef.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de ropa, venta de comida y venta de útiles de escritorio, algunos socios brindan servicios de turismo e informática y otros trabajan en hospitales, en clínicas dentales y otras en entidades públicas y privadas. La socia Carmen nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene un hijo hermoso. La socia trabaja como administradora de una pastelería y le va muy bien, ella también tiene su propio negocio que es una ferretería. Ya son 7 años que tiene el negocio de la ferretería y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carmen desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo clavos, pinturas y otras cosas más que faltan en la tienda. (La socia carmen esta levantando la mano en la fotografia).

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Banco del Desarrollo” (Bank of Development) in the city of Cusco. This Communal Bank consists of individuals who look for opportunities to get ahead and strive each day to provide a better future for their children. The businesses the members engage in include selling clothes, selling food, selling writing supplies, and providing tourism and information services. Other members work in hospitals, dental clinics, and other public and private institutions.

Carmen is a member who was born in the city of Cusco. She is 32 years old and has a beautiful child. Carmen manages a pastry shop and has done very well. She also owns a hardware business. Her hardware store has been in operation for seven years and it has been successful thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Carmen is taking advantage of this opportunity so that she can buy merchandise such as nails, paints, and other products that her store is lacking. In the photo, Carmen is the woman who has her hand raised.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete their loan payments according to the established terms.

Cusco is located in the District and Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. The heart of this ancient city of the Incas is where many archaeological sites are located. The historical center and the landscapes help make Cusco the most enchanting city in the southern region of Peru. Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy nails, paints, and other hardware goods.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
This is Madelyn, 30, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a food vendor, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household as she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Madelyn makes and sells rice cakes and rice dishes. These are foods are commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after meal for desserts. She sells it per order, and it is in demand on special occasions and holidays.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, sugar, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Madelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her parents a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, aged 47, is a married mother who has been engaged in farming rice on 5-hectare area of farmland in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has seven children, three of whom are dependent on her.  One helps the family’s business while the remaining are still in school. Having been in the farming business for ten years, she is able to earn about 18,000KHR per day and manages to save about 8,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient water supply is the main challenge for her rice-paddy business. 

Oun has been with VisionFund for three cycles and fully repaid the past loans, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. She has smartly used the past loans to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to request another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and timely to get a high yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
This is Luzvilla, 50, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a tricycle driver, and is mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Luzvilla oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Luzvilla is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luzvilla dreams of being able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. The is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their tricycle unit

loans.name: Julio Ignacio

texts.es: Julio tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos  .Cuenta que desde muy pequeño sus padres era un comerciantes .Por eso el también siguió esos pasos, actualmente el trabaja como comerciante en un establecimiento que tienen en libertad, ahorrar para poner mi propio negocio en casa y un camioneta  para transportar mi mercadería de ropa. El con su esposa trabaja de 9:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo él quiere comprar mucha más Mercadería :abrigo,toldo ,blusa,sabanas
texts.en: Julio is 35, married, and has two children. He says that his parents were merchants, and, therefore, he followed in their footsteps. He is a merchant and has a store in Libertad. He saves so that he can have a business at home and a truck to transport clothing. He works with his wife from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as coats, tarps, blouses, and sheets.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as coats, tarps, blouses, and sheets.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini, who lives in the city of Mombasa, has three children for whom he strives tirelessly to provide with a life of dignity that’s free from want. He owns a well-stocked fruit and vegetable store in Likoni where he’s worked with his family for more than two years. It’s important to point out that he is also a mason. Samini, a devoted man who likes his job, at times uses his bicycle to sell his products door to door.

Samini is requesting this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to keep the store well-stocked. He is grateful for the opportunity he is getting because it will enable him to stay in business and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nueva Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA SOLIDARIDAD”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mery es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, venta de queso, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, venta de trabitas, ayudante de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mery es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso, da a conocer que esta actividad la aprendió de su madre hace años, posteriormente inicio su propio emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las personas que elaboran de su comunidad, posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Solidaridad" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the Alto Lima regional office. It is composed of six members, and is led by a Board of Directors of which Mery is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include: knitting sweaters, sale of cheese, sale of perfumes, sale of clothing, sale of hair clips, and builder's helper. 

The loan they will now take out will benefit small-business owners, of which Mery is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, at the invitation of a field representative who came to visit her at home. Currently she has a business selling cheese. She says that she learned this work from  her mother years ago, and subsequently began her own venture.
 
The current loan is so that she can increase her working capital by buying cheese, which she will acquire from the people in her community who make it. Later, she will sell it in the markets in the city of El Alto. This form of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family as far as possible, as she is in a common-law relationship and has four children.  

When asked which she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the savings program.

loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 24, single and lives with four family members; he is the only provider for the family.

Abdallah owns a shop for women clothing. He established his business in 2011. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2400 youth loan to renovate the shop and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is glad because his dedication and perseverance in his farming and livestock business have allowed him to overcome trials in life. He loves to care for animals because it helps him very much and most especially in generating funds for his family's needs. He raised three pigs, one sow and 30 goats. Oscar started his livestock business in the year 1990. He plans to increase the number of pigs he raises so that he can send his two children to higher levels of education. To make his dream possible, he is seeking a loan of PHP 25,000. This amount of loan will really be a big help in obtaining his goal in life because he can improve the growth of the hogs he raises by providing necessary livestock feed and vitamins.Oscar believes that success in life relies on wise management and hard work.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family. Mohamad owns a shop selling chicken meat. He specializes in selling fresh meat. He established his business in 2009 and has now a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2400 to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Mr.Batmunkh, 27 years old, lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Khovd province of Mongolia. His wife Altantuya is a 27-year-old salesperson. His two children, five and two years old, go to kindergarten.

Every year, Mr. Batmunkh supplies vegetables to a military unit of Tsagaannuur Soum of Bayan-Olgii province. This year, his estimated sales for vegetables supplies is around 20 tonnes. He also started a taxi service business in 2007. Well-experienced and popular in his town, he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase two tires and vegetable inventory for his vegetable retail business.

loans.use: to purchase two tires and vegetable inventory for his vegetable retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothes for selling at profit.

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en:
Dolor, who is 29 years old, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Crisanto, a station loader, and a father to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Dolor operates a meat stall. She buys meat from suppliers who deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork and chicken. Many patrons prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue funding the operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken meat needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dolor hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of pork and chicken.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is a 31-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and five dependent children in a village in the Moungkoul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. Besides growing rice on six-hectare area of farmland, she also sells grocery items to earn extra income for the family. She can earn about 50,000KHR per day and manage to save almost 20,000KHR daily after offsetting her expenses.

Chantha’s group consists of two women. A first-cycle borrower with VisionFund, she and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. Chantha will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and more grocery items to sell such as salt, eggs, sugar, etc. She hopes to earn more income from the business to maintain good progress in her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 58 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo podemos apreciar lugares turísticos como las “Islas Ballestas”, las cuales reciben a muchos turistas en todo el año. Rosa es madre de 4 hijos y junto con su esposo han trabajado muy duro para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor a sus hijos. Desde muy pequeña rosa aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres no tenían muchos ingresos y por ello Rosa tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyarlos; es por ello que Rosa es muy trabajadora, poco a a poco con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa desde hace ya 5 años, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar ropa para niños como vestidos, poleritas, politos, entre otros y de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y sobre todo porque podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de Vida”.
texts.en: Rosa is 58 years old, she lives in the town of Pisco, which boasts a warm and welcoming climate. The Ballestas Islands nearby also attract flocks of tourists year in and year out. Rosa has four children. Together with her husband, she worked very hard to make sure they live with dignity. They love their children very much. Rosa learned at a very young age what it means to earn one's bread at the sweat of one's brow, since her parents were very poor and she had to work to help support the family. She emerged from the experience a very hardworking woman. Thus, little by little, and sparing no effort, she was able to save enough to start her clothing sales business five years ago. She attributes its success to her amenity towards clients and her desire to get ahead. Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy children's clothes to sell, such as dresses, T-shirts, tiny polo shirts, and others. This way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of products, increase her income and keep fighting to make her greatest dream come true: "I want to improve my quality of life".

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Primero De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMERO DE OCTUBRE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yolanda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de carnicería, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, artesanía en mantas de vicuña, venta de cocina y horno, venta de refrescos y sopa de fideo, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yolanda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a macramé; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de unas amigas que le enseñaron la técnica, posteriormente ella inicio su propio emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para inicio de un negocio paralelo (compra de máquinas carniceras) que adquirirá de empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank “PRIMERO DE OCTUBRE”  will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal in Cascada. The group has nine members, and Yolanda is president of the group. The members' businesses include a butcher shop, blanket weaving, making handmade vicuña blankets, selling prepared foods and baked goods, selling beverages and noodle soup, and making skirts. 

The loan benefits micro business owners such as Yolanda, who says she just joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a representative of the institution who visited her home. She currently weaves macramé, a trade she learned from friends who taught her the techniques. She later started her own business. 
 
Yolanda will use this loan to start another business, buying machines for butcher shops. She will purchase the machines from dealers in the city of El Alto and set them up in her home. This business will let her generate the most resources to support her family; she is married and has two children. When asked what she liked most about Pro Mujer, she said she liked the training.

loans.use: to buy machines for butcher shops.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap lives with her spouse in the village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a 36-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice on a 3-hectare area of farmland for 10 years. To add up more income, her husband also works as a construction worker in the local area. Her family daily income is about 20,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

Pheap has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. The past loans, which she completely paid back, have supported her family's living conditions. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a new loan. Pheap will use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on purchasing necessary construction supplies for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her family to earn a large income so as to better her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
