Elizabeth is 43 years old, married and has four children. She has a green grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She also does farming for more income generation. Her desire is to grow her grocery business in the future so as to employ people.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Eldy

texts.en:
This is Eldy. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eldy dreams of growing his business. He hopes to give his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Basem owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2002 and now he has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to redecorate the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to redecorate the shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is a very hard-working, devoted and polite person who lives in the suburban area of Likoni. She is still operating a food stall that is home-based. She takes care of three children, all of whom are in school. 

Thanks to the previous loan she has had an improvement in her business.For the past few weeks, demand for more dishes has increased. She does not want to disappoint her customers, so she is requesting for support in the form of loan so as to buy beans, cooking oil, maize and wheat flour and charcoal for cooking. This way she will continue to provide the services required to fulfill her customer's needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, cooking oil, maize and wheat flour and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is 29 years old and is married with three children who are five and nine years old. He owns a business transporting people. He has been in this business for two years and he works from 6 am until 10 pm every day. 

Gervais has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) for his motorcycle transport business. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tires, engine and a mirror) for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma de parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente a  la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, su venta de ropa es específicamente para adultos  y para la casa como paños de cocina, cortinas.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras y negocios donde encuentra gran variedad en ropa y calidad a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará chalecos, paños de cocina, sabanas, ropa interior, camisetas y cortinas.
Una de las metas de Maria es crecer y mantener su rubro para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida y buen bienestar  económico a su familia.
Maria vive junto a su hija de 31 años de edad, su yerno y su nieta de 7 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es dedicarse al cien por ciento a su negocio, y darle una buena atención a su clientela, y a nivel personal arreglar su casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación y respeto.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the "El Milagro" ("The Miracle") Communal Bank in the city of Curicó.

She works in the area of clothing sales, which she has done for two years. She remarks that she works from Monday to Saturday and makes her schedule depending on her availability. Her sales specialize in adult clothing and household items like dishcloths and curtains. 

She buys her merchandise from different distributors and businesses in Santiago, where she finds a great variety of quality clothing at a low cost, which makes it economically convenient.

With this loan, she will buy vests, dishcloths, sheets, undergarments, t-shirts and curtains.

One of Maria's goals is to grow and maintain her business in order to generate more income so that she can achieve a better quality of life and economic well-being for her family.

Maria lives with her 31 year-old daughter, her son-in-law, and her 7 year-old granddaughter. Her dreams on a professional level are to dedicate herself one hundred percent to her business and to serve her customers well. On a personal level, her dream is to fix her house.

She is very happy with and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. She remarks that the training workshops have been fundamental to her business as well as to her personal development, as she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments. In regards to her communal bank, she remarks that they have very good communication and respect for one another.

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the country's central zone. Curicó has a Mediterranean climate considered to be one of the most pleasant in the country. It is characterized by its naturally beautiful surroundings and a culture centered around wine. Despite its growing work force, this zone continues to be, according to the last census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: to buy vests, dishcloths, sheets, undergarments, t-shirts and curtains

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Con 61 años, Jacinto tiene una matrimonio con Cenobia, quienes logran darle a su hijo Niker de 27 años una educación superior. Tienen una casa de material noble, donde viven juntos. Para poder crecer como familia fue necesario desempeñarse en otras áreas del comercio que ofrecía su localidad y fue la idea de abrir una tienda de abarrotes, debido a la demanda que existía. Desde hace 7 años y aprovechando las instalaciones de su hogar, se consolidaron como los favoritos del barrio, siendo su esposa quien lidera el negocio. Él Trata siempre de buscar nuevas maneras de poder crecer a pesar de los constantes desabastecimientos en las que incurren, por ello están habilitando un pequeño espacio en su hogar donde podrá ser usado como un mini almacén y así poder realizar las compras en mayor cantidad para contrarrestar este inconveniente. Para ello aplicaran su crédito para concretar sus planes a corto plazo. En tanto Jacinto tiene planeado de ampliar su negocio a futuro con el mismo apoyo de MFP, por ahora habrá que priorizar  los productos al por mayor. Ya cuenta con 18 experiencias y del que se caracteriza por cumplir a tiempo y personalmente expresa a su banco comunal  el deseo de seguir trabajando de manera conjunta. Con los 3,000 podrá realizar la compra de sacos de arroz, conservas y cereales  a fin de asegurar un abastecimiento continuo para su negocio
texts.en:
At 61 years of age, Jacinto is married to Cenobia. They have been able to provide a higher education for their 27-year-old son Niker. Jacinto and his wife live in a home that is made of solid materials. In order to grow as a family, they needed to develop an area of trade that they could offer in their town. As a result, they came up with the idea to open a grocery store so that they could meet the existing demand. They established their business in their home seven years ago and it has become one of the favorite shops in town. His wife is the manager of the business. Jacinto is always looking for new ways to grow the business despite the constant shortages that occur. For this reason, they utilized a small space in their house that could be used as a mini-warehouse so that they could buy in large quantities and overcome this challenge. The loan will help Jacinto carry out his short-term plans.

In the meantime, Jacinto looks to expand his business in the future with the support of MFP. For now, his main priority is buying products in bulk. He has already had 18 loans and is known for completing his payments on time. Jacinto would like to personally express his desire to continue working with his Communal Bank in a cooperative manner. His loan of 3,000 PEN will be used to buy sacks of rice, preserves, and grains so that he can keep his business continually stocked.

loans.use: to buy rice, preserves, and grains.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is from Iraq. He is 43 years old and married, and he has five children, one of whom is employed.

Jaber owns a shop for construction materials. In 2008 he established his own business, and he has now one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita, She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quality golf balls to sell. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more golf balls. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Pacita hopes to give a good life to her children and grandchildren. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members.  All CCT community partners are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quality golf balls to sell.

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Bathuyag is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a Ger in Bulgan province, Mongolia. His wife, Tserenhand, is 50 years old. His older son, Tserenbat, is 24 years old. His older daughter, Darhijaw, is 21 years old.  She is a sales person in a grocery store. His younger son, Erdenet-Od, is six years old. He is a primary school student.  

Mr. Bathuyag started his business 20 years ago planting vegetables and selling vegetables on the black market. He is well-experienced in this industry. In 2012, he is planning to keep vegetables in the autumn and to sell them on in winter. He is a hard-working and honest man. He is asking for 1,300,000 MNT to purchase a more vegetables to sell at a retail price.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell during the winter and spring for a higher price.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family. Jaber owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2011 and now he has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2000 loan to renovate the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is from Iraq. He is 38 years old and married, with four children. He is the only provider for the family.

Hamza owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2008, and he has now one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Oday

texts.en:
Oday is from Iraq. He is 35 years old married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family. Hamza owns a shop manufacturing aluminium ware. He established his business in 2008 and he now has an employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Vuthdy's Group

texts.en:
Vuthdy, a 42-year-old widowed mother of three children, resides in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She lives with her youngest brother. Of her three children, she still has one child to take care of who is still in school. To make a living, she has been working as a paid construction worker in a local area while her brother helps the family to earn extra income by working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. The current business earns her family 40,000 KHR per day and allow them to save 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Vuthdy’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles. The previous loans, which she completely paid back, have supported her business and improved her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a proper motorbike for her brother’s transportation service because the old motor was seriously broken. Vuthdy hopes this loan will enable her brother to have a decent motor so their income will increase and they will improve their standard of living through providing a transportation service.

loans.use: To buy a proper motorbike for her brother’s transportation service.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children. His wife works and helps with the family income.

Akil owns a small cafeteria for fast food. He has acquired this profession by working as an employee in the fast food industry. He established his business in 2006 after a good experience in the fast food business. He now has an employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to buy a generator and a refrigerator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a refrigerator

loans.name: Freya Enelina

texts.es: Freya de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos Ella comenzó en la venta de comida rápidas vendiendo empanada de verdes hamburguesa, actualmente ella se independizo y trabaja junto con una amiga .Ella trabaja desde la 6.am hasta 15:00pm. Su meta es tener un gran restaurante de comidas típicas ecuatorianas .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina una y ollas y platos y pollos para criar y vender
texts.en:
Freya is single and has no children. She began selling fast food, such as green plantain empanadas and hamburgers. At the moment, she is independent and works with the help of a friend. Freya works from 6 A.M. to 3 P.M. Her goal is to open a successful restaurant that serves traditional Ecuadorian food.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a stove, pots, dishes, and chickens that she can raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy a stove, pots, dishes, and chickens that she can raise and sell.

loans.name: Cristobal Colon

texts.es: Cristóbal tiene 58 años de edad estado civil casado, tiene 3 hijos .la profesión de Cristóbal es taxista ese ha sido su manera de sustento desde hace tiempo, pero ahora el alquila el taxi pra que un amigo lo maneja .su anhelo es que su negocio en su casa de comidas rapidas siga prosperando y comprarse otro carro. Con el préstamo él quiere comprarse otro carro
texts.en: Cristóbal is 58 years old, married, and has three children. Cristóbal is in the taxi business. This has been the way he's supported himself for a long time, but he currently rents the taxi so his friend can drive it. His dreams are for the fast food business he has in his house to continue prospering and to buy another car. With this loan, he would like to buy another car.

loans.use: to buy another car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs Bayarmaa is 43 years old and lives with her mother and two children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent) in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. Her two children, Batmunh and Uuganstetseg, are aged 27 and 21.

She started working as a hairdresser in a rental workplace in 1990. She is well-experienced in this business. She is a hardworking and open-minded person. 

She is planning to open her own barber shop. She already has become her customers' favorite in that area. She needs financial support of 1,500,000 MNT to buy equipment and other tools to open her own hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and other tools to open her own hairdressing business

loans.name: Carolina Silveria

texts.es:
La señora Carolina tiene 29 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 11 años de elaborar Cortes.

Solicita un préstamo que utilizara para ampliar su capital de producción de tejido  e invertir un poco en la tienda que tiene, va a comprar hilos y productos para tienda en general, espera aumentar su producción y ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carolina is 29 years old, married, and works as a weaver. "Elaboration of Typical Skirts for Women" has a workshop with two looms. She lives with her husband and they do the same type of work. They have two employees who also do the same work. Carolina has been making skirts for 11 years.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to increase her capital for producing fabric and to invest a bit in her store. She is going to buy thread and products for the store in general. She hopes to increase her production and sales. She is also hoping that she will be able to move her family ahead and achieve better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for crafts-making

loans.name: Carolina Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 29 años de edad estado civil soltera ,no tiene hijos .Ella Comenzó con poca mercadería a vender  víveres ella vendía cola, arroz,  para luego formar una  tienda de víveres en su casa pues eso es lo que ahora es su sustento de vida para Ella y su familia. Desde las 7:00am abre su negocio hubo un tiempo que decayó en su  salud por eso su tienda se iba decayendo un poco pero ahora ya se recupero y estoy bien por lo también los fines de semana voy a ponerse a vender en un puesto cerca de su casa lo que es comida rápida. Ella anhela que su negocio crezca más y poderlo surtir con mas productos. Pues con el préstamo el comprara mas víveres como .arroz, azúcar, aceite y mejorar su vivienda y su tienda etc.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 29 years old. She is single and has no children. She started with a small amount of merchandise to sell. She sold products such as soft drinks and rice, and later set up a grocery store in her home, as that is now the way she supports her and her family. She opens her business from 7:00am on. 

There was a period when she was in poor health, and that is why her store was getting a bit run-down. But now she has recovered, and is well, so that  on weekends she is also going to start selling fast food at her stand near her home. 

She has a great desire to see her business grow, and to stock it with more products. So with the loan, she will buy more groceries such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil, and improve her home and her store.

loans.use: To buy more products such as rice, sugar and cooking oil, and to improve   her store and her home.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддасу 27  лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Более 7 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как лук, пшеницу, огурцы и т.п. Полученный доход она продает на рынке. Ее муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Мукаддас имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Мукаддас должна заплатить наемным работникам их зарплату, так как она данное время не имеет деньги она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000  сомони.  Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukaddas is 27 and married with 2 children. She has been raising crops, such as onions, wheat, and cucumbers, for more than 7 years. She sells her produce at a market. Her husband helps her run her business.
Mukaddas receives additional income from animal farming. She must pay her hire workers, and since she currently doesn't have the money to, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni. She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her hire workers

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en:
Nikola is thirty-one years old, married and lives in a Serbian community. For more than fifteen years he has worked as a musician. His clients are all types of people who live in Kosovo who organize a celebration or event and are in need of entertainment.

In the beginning, Nikola would perform in the homes of people for small family parties. Now he performs with his orchestra band in events that host more than 400 guests.

Nikola is requesting a loan in order to purchase another musical instrument (accordion). This loan will help him to improve the quality of his music and therefore earn more income for him and his family. 

He is very happy and thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to purchase another musical instrument (accordion)

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a 48-year-old married woman with three children, one girl and two boys, from Corella, Bohol. The oldest child is 24 years old.

Elpedia has been in the hog raising business for 5 years. She plans to use her loan to buy additional piglets and feeds.

In the future, Elpedia would like to improve her hog raising business to make her venture sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
This is Joana, 35, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Single, she manages her own business to be able to sustain her everyday expenses.

Joana has a store that offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Her store is located in a market where customers can easily see her products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of supplies and products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Joana dreams to have a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Mwamsuka

texts.en:
Mwamsuka is a married man who has two grown children. He earns a living by selling fish at the market. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Mwamsuka goes to the market every afternoon and spends the afternoon session selling his fish. He says that he depends on motorcycle [transportation] to reach the market from his home. He says that some of the motorcycle taxi operators transport him free.

Mwamsuka is asking for this loan to open a new business. He wants to purchase cereals and fruits to sell in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and fruits to sell in his neighborhood.

loans.name: Rubiel Alonso

texts.es: Rubiel tiene 40 años y su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa y calzados en la ciudad de Cartagena. La demanda para sus productos normalmente aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, y por eso está solicitando un crédito de Kiva para comprar sandalias, chanclas, y otros calzados para damas, caballeros y niños. Él tiene 15 años de experiencia en este negocio, trabajando todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la tarde. Sus clientes son vecinos y otra gente de otros sectores, que lo conocen y lo referencian. El Credikiva es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y él espera que con este financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará calzado, ropa y artículos de bisutería que le han encargado,  su negocio crezca un poco más. Rubiel tiene una hija de 20 años, un hijo de 10 años y un bebe, de solo 8 meses, así que es muy importante para Rubiel que su negocio tenga éxito, porque con él apoya el bienestar familiar y sus hijos son el foco de todos sus sueños – Rubiel espera que, por el esfuerzo de él y su cónyuge,   sus tres hijos puedan ser profesionales y vivir con mucha  comodidad.
texts.en:
Rubiel is forty years old and he sells clothing and shoes in the city of Cartagena.  The demand for his products normally grows towards the end of the year.  Therefore, he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy sandals, flip-flops, and other shoes for women, men, and children.  He has fifteen years of experience in this business, working every day from 7 in the morning until 7 at night.  

His customers are neighbors and people from other parts of town that know him and who have been referred to him.  This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he hopes that with this financing (which he will use to buy shoes, clothes, and costume jewelry that customers have requested) that his business will grow a little more.

Rubiel has a twenty-year-old daughter, a ten-year-old son, and a baby who is only eight months old.  It is very important to Rubiel that his business is successful because he supports the well-being of his family and his children are the focus of everything he does.  Rubiel hopes that, through the strength of himself and his spouse, that his three children can become professionals and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and costume jewelry that customers have requested.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics to be used in her work as a seamstress.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Milagro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de confección y costuras, desde hace 25 años. Realizó algunos cursos de especialización, lo que le permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Específicamente confecciona uniformes, buzos y poleras de colegio.
Nancy se desempeña en sus labores de costuras y confección de lunes a domingos y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ella busca su clientela, así como también llegan a su casa para realizar pedidos de uniformes. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra telas de gran calidad y variedad de colores a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente telas de gran calidad y variedad en colores.
Una de las metas de Nancy es continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Nancy vive junto a su marido y cuatro hijos de 25, 22, 17 y 9 años de edad, quienes se encuentran todos estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un taller solo para sus costuras y confecciones, y a nivel familiar darles una buena educación para sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy contenta con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras, ya que son muy unidas y existe respeto.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the "El Milagro" communal bank in the city of Curicó. She has been a dressmaker for 25 years.  She took some specialized courses which allowed her to improve herself and launch her business. 

Specifically, she makes uniforms, track suits and skirts, for school. She carries on her sewing work and dressmaking from Monday to Sunday, and distributes her hours of work in accordance with her availability. 

She seeks out customers, and they also come to her home to place orders for uniforms. She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, at distributors and shops where she finds high-quality fabric in a variety of colors, at low cost, and therefore affordable. 

With the loan, she will buy high-quality fabrics only, in a variety of colors. One of Nancy's goals is to continue with her business, in order to generate greater income, and with this, access a better quality of life.

Nancy lives with her husband and four children, ages 25, 12, 17 and 9, who are all in school. Her dream for her work is to have a workshop just for her sewing and dressmaking, and at the family level, to provide her children with a good education. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as it has allowed her to invest in her business. In addition she feels very happy to be with the other entrepreneurs, as they are very close-knit group and there is respect. 

Curicó is located in the Maule region, in the central part of the country. Curicó's climate is Mediterranean and is considered one of the most pleasant in the country. It is also known for its culture related to wine, and for its beautiful natural surroundings.

Despite the fact that the workforce has grown, this area continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: To buy high-quality fabric only, in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Nonvignon Awake Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON AWAKE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Victor. Christine est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins des enfants. Il y a onze années que Christine mène comme activité la vente des condiments à son domicile. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Christine mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Christine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON AWAKE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: NONVIGNON AWAKE is a group of four people whose members live in the same village in Benin.  The leader of the group, Christine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old and married to a man named Victor.  Christine is the mother of five children who all attend school and who are still in her care. Christine lives with her children and her husband.  Together, the couple is able to meet the various needs of the children. For eleven years Christine has run a business selling condiments from her home.  She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.  Christine runs this business in order to meet the needs of her children.  In the hopes of meeting the demand of her customers, she is requesting a first loan, along with the other members of the NONVIGNON AWAKE group.  This loan will allow them to respond better to the demand of their customers and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONQUISTADORAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de juguetes, tejido de chompas y mantas, macramé de mantas, tienda de barrio, artesanía

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejidos, da a conocer que aprendió este negocio al ayudarle a su familia, posteriormente emprendió su propio negocio con un pequeño capital.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lanas e hilos) que adquirirá de las proveedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en distintos departamentos de Bolivia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Conquistadoras will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. They have eight members and are headed by a board with María as president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and among them are: selling toys, weaving sweaters and blankets, macramé blankets, grocery stores, and crafts.

The loans they are taking out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs where María is a member. She says that she has two cycles as a member of Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation from a friend that is a member of the institution. Currently she has a weaving business, and discloses that she learned this business in order to help her family, later starting her own business with a small amount of capital.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (to buy wool and yarn) to buy from the suppliers in the city of El Alto and later to make and sell in different departments of Bolivia. This way of working allows her to earn income in order to support her family as much as she can, as she is a widow with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool and yarn for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es: Rosa tiene 25 años de edad estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años Ella cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de desempleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar : perfumes, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Rosa is 25 years old and single. She has a 3 year old son. She says that she started this business because of the lack of employment in the country and that she wanted to find work, but could not. She therefore decided to sell all types of cosmetics and this has gone very well for her. She works in the afternoons and offers all the goods that she has to her neighbors. She wants to use the loan to buy: perfumes, creams, deodorants, talcs, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, talcs, etc

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel de 31 anos de edad, soltero sin hijos, del departamento de Chinandega. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de celulares y accesorios, tiempo de tener el negocio 5 anos. Negocio que lo tiene ubicado en unos de los parques de la localidad. El negocio surgió anos atrás con la venta de DVD y cd actualmente el sr ha dado un giro en el negocio ya que desde hace un ano que tiene la venta de celulares en un 100 % esto ha sido con el apoyo que le dieron sus padres y el apoyo que le ha otorgado la institución con los prestamos siempre para invertir en capital de trabajo. Luis Manuel ha  demostrado que es responsable con sus pagos en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo en invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar nuevos celular con tecnología más avanzada, y accesorios como protector de pantallas, baterías, colgantes, teclado, carcazas. Luis Manuel agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel is 31 years old. He is single, has no children, and is from Chinandega department. For five years, he has had a business selling cell phones and accessories. His business is located in one of the local parks. The business came about some years ago, with the sale of DVDs and CDs. 

Now he has made a shift in the business, as for a year he has been 100% selling cell phones. This is been with the support his parents gave him, and the support that the institution has granted him through the loans; always so that he can invest in working capital. 

Luis Manuel has shown that he is responsible by making his payments in a timely manner. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital, and to buy new cell phones with more advanced technology; as well as to buy accessories such as screen protectors, batteries, straps, keyboards and covers.

Luis Manuel is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders provide to low-income people and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent way to make a living.

loans.use: To invest in his business selling cell phones with advanced technology, as well as accessories.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 48, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a taxi driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Erlinda oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. She herself drives their own tricycle. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erlinda dreams of being able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, 40, stopped her education in the 7th grade. She lives at Congo town and is married with three children, aged 3 to 21, who are presently in school. 

She started this business with a little amount that she received from her saving club. She has been selling washing soap in her community for the past ten years. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys palm oil and caustics to fix more soap, to improve the business, and pay for the education expenses of her children.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more palm oil and caustics to increase her sales. Her dream for the future is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and caustics to increase her sales of washing soap.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy lives with his wife in a very humble abode of his own. He is an enterprising person who very much wants to get ahead. He is involved in the tailoring business. He is well known in the area where he lives for being very cheerful, optimistic, and hardworking.

Timothy needs to stock up on sewing supplies. He also needs to make some changes to his sewing machine, among other things, which is why he’s asking Yehu for a loan to invest in his business. He will use the loan to buy supplies such as fabric at cost, needles, and spare parts like bobbins and blades, which help to fine-tune his work so he may get ahead as entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and spare parts such as bobbins and blades.

loans.name: Rosa Baltazara

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años de edad estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos .Ella Comenzó con poca mercadería a vender  víveres ella vendía cola, arroz,  para luego formar una  tienda de víveres en su casa pues eso es lo que ahora es su sustento de vida para Ella y su familia. Desde las 7:00am abre su negocio hubo un tiempo que decayó en su  salud por eso su tienda se iba decayendo un poco pero ahora ya se recupero y estoy bien por lo también los fines de semana voy a ponerse a vender en un puesto cerca de su casa lo que es comida rápida. Ella anhela que su negocio crezca más y poderlo surtir con mas productos. Pues con el préstamo el comprara mas víveres como .arroz, azúcar, aceite y mejorar su vivienda y su tienda etc.
texts.en: 47 year old Rosa is married and has 2 children. She began selling groceries with very little merchandise, selling cola and rice. Later, she created a grocery store in her home and now this is the source of livelihood for her and her family. She opens her business at 7:00am. There was a while when her health was bad and for this reason her store was doing a little badly. But, now she has recuperated and is doing well. At the weekends she sells fast food from a stall close to her home. She longs for her store to grow more and to be able to supply it with more products. She will use the loan to buy more groceries such as rice, sugar, and oil and to improve her home and store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and to improve her home and store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Mahuwanu Group

texts.fr: MAHUWANU est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Yaotcha (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Jeorges. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Yaotcha et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Yaotcha n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Yaotcha mène comme activité la vente de farine de manioc, des galettes d'arachide et du pain à son domicile. Yaotcha exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Yaotcha s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Yaotcha sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUWANU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Mahuwanu is a group of five individuals living in the same house. The group’s representative, Yaotcha (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 32 years old. Her husband’s name is Jeorges. They have six children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. Yaotcha never attended school. For almost 10 years, Yaotcha has been selling manioc [cassava] flour, peanut cookies and bread out of her home. Yaotcha is dedicated to her work, which permits her to provide for herself and her children. Yaotcha stocks up at one of the Benin markets. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Yaotcha, along with the other members of the Mahuwanu group, is seeking her first loan. This loan will allow the group members to better meet customer demand and increase their revenues.

loans.use: to buy manioc flour, peanut cookies, peanuts and bread.

loans.name: Palomas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMAS”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de víveres.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace quince ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de comida (Pensión), da a conocer que anteriormente ella vendía en un establecimiento educativo, posteriormente ingresó a Pro Mujer y con el crédito y con sus ahorros pudo iniciar este negocio que es mas grade y le trae mayor ingresos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Palomas" ("Doves") Communal Association is starting its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. The group is comprised of eight members and is directed by a board, of which Virginia is the president. The businesses that this group's members carry out are various, including plastics sales, food sales, grocery sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, and grocery sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit their small businesses. Virginia is one member, who says that she joined Pro Mujer 15 cycles ago, on invitation by a friend who was a member of the institution. Today, she has a food service business (a "pensión"). She used to sell at a school but after she joined Pro Mujer -- with the loan she received and her savings -- she was able to start this business, which is larger and creates more income.

The loan Virginia is taking out now will increase her capital for buying provisions that she will obtain at markets in the city of El Alto, and then for making and selling food in her sales space. This type of work allows Virginia to generate the resources she needs to support her family. She is divorced and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Virginia responds that she likes the training workshops and the savings.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family. Ali owns a carpentry shop. He acquired this profession by working as an employee in carpentries for several years. In 2007, he established his own carpentry shop. He now has three employees and a good reputation in his local community.

Ali is requesting a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Smilja

texts.en:
Smilja is a 56-year-old married woman who has two young children. She lives with her family in a Serbian community in Kosovo. Her husband receives a pension. Twelve years ago she began to run her own boutique. 

She started with a small store selling clothes and has been able to expand since then, still hoping to continue to expand the business even further. She sells different types of clothing for people with a variety of tastes and styles. 

Smilja is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing and expand her collection to meet customer needs. She is also considering adding different styles of clothing in order to appeal to other clientele and increase her customer base. She hopes to expand her business and own a large boutique shop and be able to hire an employee to assist her. 

She serves Albanians and other community members living in Kosovo. Smilja is very thankful to Kiva lenders for this help and appreciates all lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothing and expand her collection.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a bold and energetic married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for the past three years. She started a parlor in a small corner of her two-room house. 

She is working to support her family financially. She is a mother of two. She is responsible to provide them with the basic necessities of life. She feels happy to be sending her children to school through all her hard work. Zahida works tirelessly to keep the business running because she is the only breadwinner of the house. 

She told Kashf that it was getting extremely difficult for her to manage the family, as the parlor was running on minimum necessities and her clients were hesitant to avail services as there are lots of competitors in the community. That’s when she took a loan worth Rs 30,000 from Kashf and reported that she will be investing the amount in buying more cosmetics and some furniture for the parlor to deal with more customers at a time. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in the number of customers, and she intends to utilize part of the income in buying more furniture and utensils for her parlor.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and some furniture for the beauty parlor to deal with more customers at a time.

loans.name: Prados De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRADOS DE SAN ROQUE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fania es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: albañil, producción de mantas de vicuña e hilos, carnicería, elaboración de chompas para bebe, tejido de chompas, venta de hortalizas, elaboración de polainas de alpaca, elaboración de faldas de cholita.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fania es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejidos de chompas de bebe, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento le va bien en el trabajo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lanas) que adquirirá de las proveedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The loan group Prados de San Roque (Meadows of San Roque) began their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. The group is composed of 9 members and is directed by a board of which Fania is the treasurer. The businesses that the group members run are varied and include: a mason's business, making blankets from vicuña wool and threads, a butcher's, making baby sweaters, knitting sweaters, selling vegetables, making alpaca leggings, and making traditional skirts. 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the group of micro-entrepreneurs of which Fania is a member. She says that this is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer and she joined on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business knitting sweaters for babies. She let us know that she started this business on her own initiative and, to date, she is doing well.
The loan that she is requesting now is to increase her capital to buy wool from the merchants in the city of El Alto which she will later knit and sell from her permanent stall. This type of work enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She lives with her partner and 4 children.
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the credit and health training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Daliborka

texts.en:
Daliborka is a 36-year-old married woman. She is from Kosovo and lives in a Serbian community. She has two children, 12 and 9 years old, both attending school. Her husband works as a medical technical in a hospital. 

Daliborka has been the owner of a food store for more than the last three years. She provides her products to Albanians and other nationalities that live in her community in Kosovo. She really enjoys her business of selling food to people, and she has many plans for her business in the future. At this time, she is seeking only to gather enough money to expand her business. She is requesting this loan in order to buy food products for her market. She hopes that the loan will help her increase the size of her market and the amount of products she can supply; thereby, increasing her income and then [improving] her living conditions. 

Daliborka’s goals are to expand her business and then expand her family. She is very happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy food products for her market

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 28, lives together with her friend and two children at Congo town. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 10, and are attending school. 

For the past three years, she has been selling food. She has a cookshop (restaurant) where she prepares different types of food every day. She sells six days a week. 

Her favorite soup that her customers love is cassava leaves fufu (dumpling) with soup, palm butter, and palava sauce. She makes a profit when she sells because of the good services that she renders to her customers.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to meet the demand of her customers. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, outros ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ela.
É negociante faz criação de frangos de corte. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, rações, vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. 
No futuro gostaria de terminar a ampliação da sua casa e aumentar o tamanho da capoeira, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para poder realizar estes sonhos.
texts.en: Maria is a widow and the mother of five children, some of whom are still in school.  She lives in her own home with her family and supports three grandchildren that live with her.  She has her own business raising chickens for meat.  She will use this loan to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins to increase her breeding quantity.  In the future, she would like to finish expanding her home and to increase the size of her chicken coop.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to be able to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, and vitamins to increase her breeding quantity.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is raising five hogs to be fattened, and one sow. She is 46 years old, happily married, and has three children. Eliza currently lives with her husband, father and nephew.

Eliza aims to increase her profit because she would like to have more comfortable living conditions and improve her family's financial stability. She wants to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines to ensure the proper growth of her raised hogs, but her funds are inadequate due to medical expenses for her father who has hypertension. Because of this situation, she decided to apply for another loan amounting to PHP50,000. She hopes that her hogs will become healthy upon reaching their optimum growth so she can sell them for a greater price, which will serve her family's need and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 45 years old and is the married mother of five. For the past eight years, she has been trading clothes. Robina's husband works in a small grocery store and earns a low income to support the family. Robina has a good client list and is very famous in her community for her collection. She contributes a lot to the family income and she bears the cost of her children’s education. Robina is in her ninth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she has a great repayment history.

Robina is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan to buy a large variety of clothes in different colors to expand her business and consider the taste and choice of her customers. In the future, she hopes to earn more income and spend some of it on home improvements.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of clothes in different colors to expand her business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms Razia is 50 years old and married. She has been in the business of selling bridal dresses for 15 years. She is much in demand in her town. She knows the art of satisfying customers. She offers unique dresses and gains a lot appreciation from her customers. For the improvement of her business, she needs to add more fashionable clothes to her collection. That is why she requested a loan of Rs 25,000. This is her second loan with Kashf Foundation. She hopes to increase her income and she dreams of opening a shop to display her collection.

loans.use: To buy more fashionable clothes for her collection.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Elsie from Kandeh town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 16 and 30 years old.  Her children did not go to school because she couldn't afford to pay for them. In 1999, Elsie started her weaving business alongside other businesses like the sales of cigarette, soaps, sweets and clothes at Kandeh town. She began her business because to raise income to support herself and her family. She works at the business every day, from morning to night. She describes her main business challenge as insufficient capital to operate her business.  

Elsie requires a loan to buy general stock items like cigarettes, soaps, sweets and clothes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status and send her some of her children to a vocational training school. In the future, Elsie plans to build a permanent home for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy items like cigarettes, soaps, sweets and clothes

loans.name: Khalda

texts.en:
Ms. Khalda is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of hand embroidery for five years. She is zealous in doing so and well-known in her community. She gets orders for special occasions like weddings, Eid (a holiday), etc. 

She has taken several loans for the enhancement of her business. She is in her eighth loan cycle, and has shown excellent repayment behavior. In order to fast track her business growth, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer and hence she was able to access quality microfinance services, which played a vital role in her business growth. 

Now her business has grown to an unbelievable level. She needs a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy raw material such as reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, pearls, and sequins. In this way, she will be able to complete the orders of more customers without delay.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, pearls, and sequins.

loans.name: Las Cubanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUBANITAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por Diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Domitila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, venta de fruta, venta de sopas, tienda de llamadas, venta de jugos, tienda de barrio, venta de deportivos, costura de edredones, venta de enaguas, tejido de mantas y venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Domitila es integrante, ella indica que hace años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años después de haber trabajado ayudando a una señora en la venta de este producto.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las proveedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The loan group Cubanitas began their fourth loan from Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. The group is comprised of 10 members and is directed by a board of which Domitila is the president. The businesses that the members run are varied and include: a carpentry, selling fruit, selling soaps, a business where people can make phone calls, selling games, a neighborhood store, selling sporting goods, sewing quilts, selling petticoats, weaving blankets, selling sweaters. 
The loan will benefit the group of micro-entrepreneurs of which Domitila is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for years and became a member on the invitation of a friend who was a member. Currently, she has a business selling vegetables. She let us know that she started this business some years ago after having worked helping another woman sell the same product.
The loan that she is requesting now is for increasing her capital to buy vegetables from the merchants in the city of El Alto which she will then sell from her permanent stall. This type of work enables her to generate income to help her family as much as possible. She is married and has 4 children. 
When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health trainings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nazrian

texts.en:
Nazrian is 47 years old and a married woman. For the past two years, she has been trading clothes. Nazrian needs to contribute to her family's income as her husband’s income is insufficient to cover their daily expenditures. She serves her community well and has gained popularity among her customers. Nazrian has a wide collection of clothes and she offers a variety of colors in consideration of customer taste and demand. 

Nazrian is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a large variety of clothes in different colors from the market. Her loan will help increase her capital and cash on hand to fulfill the demands of her customers. Nazrian hopes to earn more profits through increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of clothes in different colors from the market

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene 44 años y es Casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  14 y 16 años que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos desde hace ya varios años,  ella vende visitando distintas oficinas domicilios y barrios ofreciendo sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Esperanza va a usar este préstamo de  para la  Compra de una computadora para sus hijos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Apoyo para estudio de sus hijos, la Sra. Esperanza  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son La competencia,   va a utilizar los beneficios en la Construcción de su casa ya que le falta hacer construir,  su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y el de ver terminada su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Esperanza is 44 years old and married with two children who are of the ages 14 and 16, and are in school.  She makes a living selling cosmetics, which she has done for several years.  She sells door-to-door by visiting various offices and neighborhoods and offering her products.  

This loan is her first cycle within the institution.  Señora Esperanza is going to use this loan to buy a computer for her children.  Her reason of asking for the loan is for supporting her children's studies.  

Señora Esperanza faces the challenge of competition with her business.  She is going to use the profits in the construction of her home since it has not been built.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to see her house finished.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children.

loans.name: Soyla Leonor

texts.es: Soyla Leonor de  51 anos de edad, soltera sin hijos , del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Soyla tiene por actividad económica la venta de plátanos y destace de cerdos, actividades que la realiza en su casa de habitación ,  y en uno de los Mercado de la localidad. Soyla siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a su negocio. Ella tiene 23 anos en el negocio. Este negocio surgió con un poco de ahorros propios, y con los créditos que recibí de los inversionistas kiva para incrementar sus ventas. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar plátanos ya que en este momento hay bastante producción y así aprovechar las ventas, y también necesita comprar un lote de cerdos en pie que se lo están vendiendo barato. Soyla agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva  a los pequeños comerciantes para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Soyla Leonor is 51 years of age, single without children, and lives in the department of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. Soyla's economic activity is selling plantains and butchering pigs, activities that she carries out in her own home and in one of the local markets. Soyla has always been characterized as a very hard-working woman, dedicated to her business. For 23 years she has been in the business. She started her business with her own small savings, and has used the loans she has received from Kiva investors to expand sales.

The object of the present loan is to invest working capital in purchasing plantains, because there is sufficient production at present to allow her to take advantage of sales. Soyla also needs to buy a lot of pigs on foot, which are also being sold cheaply. 

Soyla appreciates the help offered to small merchants by Kiva investors, helping to provide them with dignified work.

loans.use: invest working capital in buying plantains and pigs.

loans.name: Grace A Dieu Group

texts.fr: GRACE A DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Abiba dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Abiba est mariée à un certain Hubert. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Abiba n’a pas fréquenté. Il y a près de cinq ans que Abiba mène comme activité la vente des condiments, du haricot et du riz dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Abiba vend des fournitures scolaires. Abiba exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Abiba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Abiba sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GRACE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Grâce à Dieu Group is a group of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Abiba (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old. Abiba is married to a man by the name of Hubert. The couple has five children, all of them attending school and in the couple's care. The couple lives together with the children and together sees to the various household needs.

Abiba did not attend school. For nearly the past five years, Abiba has been selling condiments, beans and rice in her area. At the same time, she sells school supplies. Abiba undertakes her business with passion, which allows her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, Abiba is seeking her first loan with the other members of the Grâce à Dieu Group. This loan will allow them to better meet customer demand and to turn a greater profit.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and various goods.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is 26 years old and lives in a Roma community with his wife and three children. For more than five years, he has worked in the family construction business. Samir works together with his father. They began their business doing small construction projects and now they have managed to complete the construction for an entire house. Samir and his father provide construction services to Albanians, Serbians, and other members of the Kosovo community. 

Samir is requesting a loan to buy tools and construction supplies for his work. He hopes to expand his company and be able to employ his own workers. Samir thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy tools and construction supplies

loans.name: Club D’Amis Group

texts.fr: CLUB D’AMIS est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent des activités génératrices de revenus dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Valerie Pascaline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Boniface. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Valerie Pascaline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Valerie Pascaline a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de huit ans que Valerie Pascaline mène comme activité la couture. Parallèlement à cette activité, Valerie Pascaline vend de la bouillie accompagnée des pâtés (faits à base de farine de blé) de façon ambulante. Valerie Pascaline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Valerie Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Valerie Pascaline sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe CLUB D’AMIS. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Club d'Amis Group is a group of three people, the members of which run profit-generating businesses in the same area. The group's representative, Valerie Pascaline (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and is married to a man by the name of Boniface. The couple has three children, certain of whom attend school and all of whom are in the couple's care. Valerie Pascaline and her husband live together with their children and together see to the various household expenses.

Valerie Pascaline stopped attending school in high school. She has been running a sewing business for nearly eight years. At the same time, she sells porridge and pasta (made from wheat flour) as a roving vendor. Valerie Pascaline undertakes this business with passion, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.

Valerie Pascaline gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, she is seeking a first loan with the other members of the Club d'Amis Group. This loan will allow them to better meet customer demand and to turn a greater profit.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, vegetable oil and sugar.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio es un señor de  40 años está casada con la señora Luisa con la cual tienen 2 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, el señor Antonio proviene de una familia de muy bajos recursos económicos, tanto que siempre vivieron  y aún viven  en alquiler en dos habitaciones donde están muy incomodos, por lo tanto don Antonio tuvo que inmigrar a España y trabajar duro para poder sacar adelante a su familia, y con mucho trabajo logro reunir y comprar un lote de terreno y además un Minibús que actualmente es su herramienta de trabajo. El señor Antonio y su familia viven en la provincia de Sacaba, su principal actividad es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, pertenece a un sindicato, en la actualidad el solo mantiene a toda la familia ya que su esposa no trabaja y se dedica por completo a sus hijos. El destino del crédito es para construcción de su casa en ese lote que se compró, esto le ayudara mucho porque de esa manera dejaran de pagar alquiler y además vivirán más cómodos. Es la segunda vez que el señor  Antonio  está solicitando el crédito de Kiva y declara que está muy contento  ya que con ese dinero ha logrado cancelar la totalidad de su terreno. Entre sus metas esta que sus hijos logren estudiar una carrera profesional y de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 40, is married to Luisa, and they have two children who are dependent upon their income.  Antonio comes from a family with very few financial resources.  They have so few resources that they still live in two rented rooms, where they are very uncomfortable.  Consequently, Antonio had to emigrate to Spain and work hard in order to get his family ahead.  With a lot of work he managed to reunite, to buy a plot of land, and to buy a minibus, which is now his work tool.

Antonio and his family live in the Sacaba province.  His main business activity is passenger transportation, and he belongs to a union.  He is currently the only one who supports his entire family.  His wife does not work because she devotes herself completely to their children.

The loan is to build his house on the lot that he bought.  This will help him a great deal because he will stop paying rent, and they will live more comfortably.  This is the second time that Antonio has requested a Kiva loan.  He says that he is very happy because with this money he has managed to finish paying for his land.  Among his goals is having his children study for a professional career.  This way they will be able to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Tigingou Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI représente le groupe TIGINGOU. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Elle se porte bien et viens d’accoucher son 3è enfant.  Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 02 mois.01 va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du savon, habits d’enfants depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont partout dans la ville car elle est ambulante.
Elle veut s’acheter 05sacs de savons.
Mme veut renforcer son activité et aider son mari dans les charges familiales avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un hangar au marché de Nabig Yaar
texts.en:
Fati is the representative of the TIGINGOU group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She is doing well and has just given birth to her third child.  Her oldest child is 13 years old and her baby is two months old.  One of her children goes to school.  She has three people in her care.
